title: Compliance Manager
description:
About the Company

Solera is changing lives by guiding people to better health solutions that work. Solera’s value-based technology platform enables successful interventions that address the most prevalent and costly chronic conditions. Solera matches consumers to their best-fit solution within carefully curated networks of digital and community-based point solutions and drives superior engagement and outcomes by managing performance. Solera’s technology platform serves payers and employers by streamlining, integrating, and creating accountability in the point solution ecosystem.




About the Role

As a Compliance Manager at Solera Health, you will play a pivotal role in advancing our compliance initiatives and ensuring adherence to regulatory requirements. You will lead and support various projects to enhance Solera’s Compliance Program, collaborating closely with stakeholders across the organization to integrate compliance strategies with business objectives effectively.




Essential Roles and Responsibilities

Update Compliance Program: Modify the Compliance Program in response to changes in regulations or business operations.
Stakeholder Collaboration: Foster strong relationships with key leaders, understanding business priorities to align and integrate compliance programs across departments.
Audit Support: Assist the Director of Compliance in conducting internal and external audits, ensuring timely completion and guiding corrective actions.
Compliance Issue Resolution: Maintain the Compliance Complaint log, overseeing prompt investigation and resolution of compliance issues.
Metrics and Reporting: Develop and monitor compliance metrics, preparing insightful reports for Senior Management.
Risk Assessment: Conduct periodic reviews to assess compliance risk and evaluate the effectiveness of compliance controls.
Policy Development: Draft, review, and update compliance policies and procedures to address regulatory changes and business needs.
Communication and Presentation: Prepare presentations for the Compliance Committee, effectively communicating key insights.
Regulatory Awareness: Stay informed about changes in regulations and industry best practices, proactively communicating updates to relevant stakeholders.




Expected Skills and Competencies

Solid understanding of laws, regulations, and industry standards in Healthcare, Health Tech, or Health Services sectors.
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment while managing multiple priorities and deadlines.
Self-driven with strong autonomy and excellent communication skills.
Detail-oriented with robust organizational and project management abilities.
Strong problem-solving skills, making data-driven decisions aligned with regulatory guidelines.
Proficiency in analyzing complex regulations and developing practical compliance strategies.




Education and Qualifications

Bachelor's Degree in Business Administration, Law, or related field; Advanced degree preferred.
Certification in Healthcare Compliance (e.g., CHC, CCEP, HCCP, or similar) is advantageous.
Minimum 3-5 years of experience in compliance and audit roles, with a significant focus on Healthcare Compliance and/or Health Tech solutions and platforms.
In-depth knowledge of healthcare regulations such as HIPAA and GDPR.
Proven track record in managing internal and external audits.




Supervisory Responsibilities

This role may involve overseeing a Compliance Analyst in the future.




Location

This is a fully remote position in the United States.




Benefits

Remote-first work environment
Competitive salary and compensation package
Flexible paid time off
Paid maternity and paternity leave
Adoption assistance program
Comprehensive medical, dental, and vision insurance
13 paid company holidays
401k retirement plan with company match
Complimentary FitBit, Sworkit, and Headspace accounts




Disclaimer




The information contained herein is not intended to be an all-inclusive list of the duties and responsibilities of the job, nor are they intended to be an all-inclusive list of the skills and abilities required to do the job. Management may, at its discretion, assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time.




EEO




Solera Health provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, Solera Health complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training.

title: Senior Data Analyst
description:
About Solera

Solera is changing lives by guiding people to better health solutions that work. Solera’s value-based technology platform enables successful interventions that address the most prevalent and costly chronic conditions. Solera matches consumers to their best-fit solution within carefully curated networks of digital and community-based point solutions and drives superior engagement and outcomes by managing performance. Solera’s technology platform serves payers and employers by streamlining, integrating, and creating accountability in the point solution ecosystem.




About the Role

We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Senior Data Analyst to join our dynamic Data Engineering team. In this role, you will leverage your advanced SQL expertise to analyze intricate datasets, deriving actionable insights that drive our data-driven initiatives forward. This fully remote position within the United States offers autonomy alongside collaboration with diverse, cross-functional teams. If you thrive in healthcare payor data analysis, excel in client interactions, and enjoy working independently, we encourage you to apply and contribute to our innovative projects.




Key Responsibilities

Data Analysis and SQL Expertise: Utilize your extensive SQL experience to analyze and interpret complex datasets.
Mapping and Testing Specifications: Lead the development and documentation of mapping specifications based on extensive data files and test case scenarios. Ensure accuracy and consistency in data transformation processes.
Healthcare Payor Data: Apply your expertise in healthcare payor data to extract meaningful insights and support data-driven decision-making.
Client Interaction: Engage directly with clients to understand their requirements, provide data insights, and effectively communicate technical concepts. Build and maintain strong client relationships.
Independence and Initiative: Proactively solve problems, take ownership of tasks, and deliver high-quality results with minimal supervision.
Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams, particularly data engineers, to enhance our data practices and contribute to ongoing data-related projects.




Requirements

Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field strongly preferred.
Minimum 5+ years of professional experience with SQL. Proficient in writing complex queries, optimizing performance, ensuring data accuracy, and manipulating large datasets.
Specific experience in analyzing healthcare payor data (e.g., claims, eligibility data).
Experience in working directly with raw data, including cleaning, transforming, and preparing it for analysis.
Led or participated in data meetings with clients or data vendors, discussing requirements, data quality, and solutions.
Experience in analyzing data files, identifying gaps in data fields or inconsistencies, and proposing solutions.
Proficiency in documenting data mappings from source to target systems, ensuring clarity and accuracy in data transformation processes
Skills in data cleansing techniques, creating reports, and visualizing data to communicate insights effectively.
Understanding of different data types, encoding methods, and their impact on data analysis and storage.




Preferred Qualifications

Experience with Google BigQuery or similar cloud-based data warehousing solutions.
Understanding of healthcare industry activities, trends, and regulations (e.g., HIPAA).
Experience in leadership or management roles, leading teams or projects.
Previous experience working in a startup environment, dealing with rapid growth and dynamic challenges.
Familiarity with Microsoft Azure cloud platform and its data services.
Familiarity with Python for data analysis.




Where you are located

This is a remote position based in the United States. Occasional travel (5%) may be required for business purposes.




Benefits

Remote-first work environment
Competitive salary and compensation package
Flexible paid time off
Paid maternity and paternity leave
Adoption assistance program
Comprehensive medical, dental, and vision insurance
13 paid company holidays
401k retirement plan with company match
Complimentary FitBit, Sworkit, and Headspace accounts




Disclaimer

The information contained herein is not intended to be an all-inclusive list of the duties and responsibilities of the job, nor are they intended to be an all-inclusive list of the skills and abilities required to do the job. Management may, at its discretion, assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time.




EEO

Solera Health provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, Solera Health complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

title: BI Developer Analyst
description:
Job Description

IT is different here. Our work as technology specialists pushes the boundaries of what’s possible in health care. You will build solutions that make a real difference in people’s lives. Driven by the importance of their work, our team members innovate to elevate. We’re encouraged to be curious, collaborate, and turn ideas into solutions that can make health care better for all.

In this role you will serve between the business and technical communities for reporting/analytic development purposes. Design and develop Business Intelligence content (reports, dashboards, scorecards, analytic solutions) by identifying reporting/analytic requirements and determining business rules through a structured elicitation process. Ensure that information and BI content satisfies Enterprise business needs and the needs of individual departments.

If you are ready to make a career out of making a difference, then you are the person for this team.

What You Will Do


Elicit and review business reporting and analytic requirements from the business groups through formal interviews or facilitated sessions and translate into technical designs for enterprise business intelligence implementation.
Develop BI content (reports, dashboards, scorecards, analytic solutions) through the entire development life-cycle to provide data necessary to effectively make business decisions and measure goal attainment and overall performance.
Participate in work-stream planning process including inception, technical design, development, testing and delivery of BI solutions that emphasize speed to market results.
Perform analysis for a wide range of requests using data in different formats and from various platforms
Assist in BI tool evaluation including the development of proof-of-concept and pilot solutions.
Develop knowledge of business area processes and information needs and apply that knowledge in designing BI content for our users.
Coordinate user acceptance testing with the business community to ensure accurate delivery of data from the business requirements with the goal of receiving sign off.
Guide and advise business areas in identifying new data needs and delivery mechanisms for reporting information as well as self-service solutions.
Provide assistance to business areas in understanding enterprise data content, definitions and usage and the available BI tools.
Work with business areas to adapt their business processes to effectively use enterprise data sources for information and analytical needs.


What You Bring


Bachelor's degree or advanced degree (where required)
3+ years of experience in related field.
In lieu of degree, 5+ years of experience in related field.
Data Visualization Skills
SQL


Salary Range

$68,200.00 - $109,100.00

title: Senior AI/ML Scientist
description:
Job Description

IT is different here. Our work as technology specialists pushes the boundaries of what’s possible in health care. You will build solutions that make a real difference in people’s lives. Driven by the importance of their work, our team members innovate to elevate. We’re encouraged to be curious, collaborate, and turn ideas into solutions that can make health care better for all.

In this role you will serve as the Senior AI/ML scientist to identify, research, and develop transformational predictive, prescriptive, and Generative AI (GenAI) solutions that translate structured and unstructured data into sound organizational decisions. Senior AI/ML scientist will combine statistical expertise, programming skills, and data science knowledge to create impactful self-learning applications and collaborate with multidisciplinary teams to integrate AI technologies into real-world systems and solutions to achieve business goals.

The AI/ML COE builds foundational AI/ML capabilities and solutions that serve multiple cross-domain business use cases and provide thought-leadership on the potential of AI/ML in delivering transformational value for the enterprise. AI/ML COE maintains and matures BCBSNC AI/ML operations environment, and AI/ML standards & best practices to enable scaling of data science solutions from ideation to prototype, automation, productionization, and integration into business workflows. AI/ML COE also maintains a community of practice for data scientists at BCBSNC and developing partnerships with universities, and other Blues plans.

What You Will Do


Own delivery of large and/or complex machine learning (ML), deep learning (DL), and Generative AI (GenAI) systems with self-learning capabilities that can adapt and evolve over time.
Design, implement, and evaluate artificial intelligence (AI) systems that can be used in production environments to meet business needs.
Apply prescriptive analytics techniques such as optimization, recommendation systems, and reinforcement learning to business problems.
Lead in the development and testing of appropriate ML algorithms, design & conduct experiments, collect and analyze data, and optimize performance of ML algorithms.
Stay updated with the advancements in artificial intelligence, machine learning, and generative AI methods and adapt new methods to effectively solve business problems.
Benchmark against existing machine learning methods and analyze results to identify strengths, weaknesses, and areas for improvement.
Develop prototypes and proof-of-concept implementations to demonstrate the feasibility and potential of new AI technologies including Generative AI.
Lead consultation sessions with business partners to distill the business needs and provide technical guidance on predictive and prescriptive AI approaches, ensuring alignment with business goals.
Drive continuous improvement by experimenting with novel techniques and refining existing models.
Leverage deep knowledge of software engineering principles in constructing sophisticated ML models and refining existing systems.
Identify actionable insights, suggest recommendations, and influence business direction by effectively communicating results to cross functional groups.


What You Bring


Bachelor's degree or advanced degree (where required)
5+ years of experience in related field.
In lieu of degree, 7+ years of experience in related field.


Salary Range

$110,000.00 - $199,000.00
Show more

title: Clinical Coding Analyst
description:
Job Description

Provides technical, clinical and coding expertise to support coding related projects. Consults/collaborates with all plan areas regarding national coding standards and applicability to BCBSNC claims processing systems and reimbursement policy. Presents findings and trends in coding practices to internal/external audiences and makes recommendations regarding coding standards.

What You'll Do


Provide consultative expertise to other areas (e.g. Compliance, Claims Operations, Legal, Network Management, third party vendors and Medical Policy) regarding current and emerging coding/documentation issues.
Develop policies and standard operating procedures for the Healthcare division, which impact multiple business areas to ensure compliance with regulatory agencies, state and federal law and ensure consistency of reviews and operations.
Obtain and maintain all Clinical Code sets as issued from CMS, AMA and ADA.
Collaborate with multiple business areas to determine & ensure proper coding logic in the claims processing systems, based on member benefits & existing guidelines
Acts as a knowledge resource to pricing & expense analyst regarding charge/pricing related issues, providing processing and programming recommendation
Identify trends in coding practices to internal/external audiences and make recommendations regarding coding standards.
Assimilate necessary documentation, including medical records, and apply clinical coding expertise to evaluate appropriateness of provider coding and assess medical necessity of services rendered with referral to Medical Director as appropriate.
Gather appropriate claims data, analyze and prepare summary of analysis to assist in the development of resource allocation strategies to meet changing business needs.
Respond to internal and external inquiries regarding specific medical procedure coding issues and provide education on proper coding techniques via written and/or telephonic communications.
Develop educational materials for providers identified as outliers and collaborate with Network Management on delivery/communication of information to provider.
Maintain documents for tracking audit results, status/outcomes of reviews etc.
Participate in or lead special projects based on business area needs requiring independent, sound decision making and broad based understanding of impact on the individual department as well as impact on corporate objectives.


What You'll Bring (Hiring Requirements)


RN or LPN with a valid NC license
3+ years of experience in related field
If LPN, 7+ years of experience in related field
Certified Professional Coder
Special Investigations Unit experience preferred


Salary Range

$68,200.00 - $109,100.00
Show more

title: AI/ML Governance Analyst
description:
Job Description

Blue Cross and Blue Shield of North Carolina has an immediate need for a governance program support analyst to support our growing Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning (AI/ML) governance program and the Principal Analyst who functions as BCNC’s primary focal point for AI/ML Strategy, Governance, & Risk Mgmt./Compliance.

In this position you will provide key programmatic support to include tracking myriad policy implementation tasks, governance actions, and compliance monitoring activities. Due to the cross-disciplinary equities of AI/ML, this position will also work closely with Enterprise Security, Privacy & Compliance, Legal, Vendor Mgmt., and Training teams, among others.

The AI/ML COE builds foundational AI/ML capabilities and solutions that serve multiple cross-domain business use cases and provide thought-leadership on the potential of AI/ML in delivering transformational value for the enterprise. AI/ML COE maintains and matures our AI/ML operations environment, and AI/ML standards & best practices to enable scaling of data science solutions from ideation to prototype, automation, productionization, and integration into business workflows. AI/ML COE also maintains a community of practice for data scientists at BCBSNC and developing partnerships with universities, and other Blues plans.

What You Will Do


Assist the Principal in tracking AI/ML-related legislation, policy, regulation, & industry standards and creating implementation plans/roadmaps
Assist the Principal in establishing and implementing our AI/ML governance and AI/ML risk management frameworks and take the lead on tasking and tracking related actions to ensure completion
Assist the Principal in performing risk evaluations of AI/ML activities and take the lead on documenting deficiencies, monitoring mitigations, and providing program metrics.
Take the lead in tracking AI/ML-related vendor actions—to include contract language disputes/drafts & vendor AI/ML assessment results-- and ensure they are tasked and completed by the appropriate SME
Help the Principal to establish notification processes where required by policy and regulation and take the lead in monitoring those processes and providing metrics, where appropriate
Assist the Principal in developing AI/ML-related governance/compliance training content and take the lead on integrating it into existing company-wide training efforts, where feasible
Establish and maintain a company-wide website/collaboration space that explains AI/ML governance rules, processes, and FAQs
Support governance forums as needed to include creating agendas, tracking action items for completion, and taking official minutes


What You Bring


Bachelor's degree or advanced degree (where required)
0-2 years of experience in related field.
In lieu of degree, 2+ years of experience in related field.


Preferred Experience


Ability to take a document or tasking and correctly discern which subject areas/organizational equities are affected
Experience supporting a governance body or working group, to include taking minutes.
Experience breaking down a policy into actionable requirements
Experience with creating new processes
Successful experience working in a heavily matrixed organization.
Some familiarity with topics related to Artificial Intelligence including Machine Learning, Generative AI, LLMs, etc., and a high-level working knowledge of how they fit together
Ability to create own structure and work successfully in a business area with constantly evolving requirements and leadership scrutiny
Experience leading the administrative aspects of a cross-disciplinary program or effort, to include metrics, action tracking, and communication
Experience developing high-quality written documentation, to include project milestones
Strong organizational skills


Salary Range

$74,000.00 - $118,200.00
Show more

title: Clinical Quality Management Analyst - 2 positions (Eastern NC and Western NC)
description:
Job Description

Support the development and maintenance of a high performing quality provider network by engaging with Accountable Care Organizations (ACOs) and independent primary care providers to promote quality improvement for NCQA Healthcare Effectiveness and Data Information Set (HEDIS) measures, MA Stars and developing improvement plans when needed. Implement and manage all Quality Management activities for assigned providers. Work closely with relevant Blue Cross NC stakeholders to educate providers regarding quality management and preventive health initiatives and programs.

What You'll Do


Some onsite clinical practice visits required (East: Wilmington area and West: Asheville area).
Maintain a collaborative working relationship with assigned providers to streamline processes related to Healthcare Effectiveness Data and Information Set (HEDIS) measures to maximize outcomes of NCQA accreditation, Medicare Stars, HEDIS Measure performance and improve provider satisfaction.
Provides guidance with interpretation of clinical aspects of Corporate Medical Policy and HEDIS Measures, develops, and implements quality improvement plans based on departmental goals. Aligns clinical decision-making processes with regulatory requirements (e.g., DOI/ERISA/NCQA). Keeps abreast of medical knowledge, care patterns, regulatory and governmental rules, and regulations.
Provides education and supports implementation of Blue Cross NC quality-based programs ensuring care cap closure (including HEDIS medical record abstraction) to improve member outcomes. Programs include but not limited to: Blue Premier and Medicare Advantage Quality Incentive Program (MAQIP).
Utilize data analysis and visualization tools to create presentations, providing relevant and actionable feedback to providers in monthly quality workstream meetings in collaboration with internal quality teams and external stakeholders.
Assists in the evaluation, development, and integration of Quality Management programs in support of new corporate initiatives. Participate in change efforts and promotes department, division, and corporate goals.
Collects, organizes, and disseminates “best practices” information regarding providers operating within Value Based Programs. Supports the development of continuous quality improvement activities.
Provides local presence for Quality Management (QM) related activities.


What You'll Bring (Hiring Requirements)


RN with 3 years of clinical experience or LPN with 5 years of clinical experience required.
Must have previous work experience in applicable business area (i.e., UM, CM, Medical Review or quality programs)
Bachelor’s degree or advanced degree preferred.


Hiring Preferences


Experience with HEDIS Clinical measures data extraction strongly preferred.
Previous experience with clinical quality improvement preferred.


Salary Range

$68,200.00 - $109,100.00
Show more

title: Sr Support Engineer, AI/ML
description:
Job Description

Blue Cross and Blue Shield of North Carolina has an immediate need for a Senior Support Engineer who will bolster our growing Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning (AI/ML) practice.

We are seeking a skilled AI/ML Support Engineer to join our team and provide technical support for our AI and machine learning applications. In this role, you will troubleshoot issues, assist users with AI/ML tools and models, and ensure the smooth operation of our AI systems. Your expertise will help in deploying, maintaining, and optimizing these AI systems effectively. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in AI/ML technologies, excellent problem-solving skills, and the ability to communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

The AI/ML COE builds foundational AI/ML capabilities and solutions that serve multiple cross-domain business use cases and provide thought-leadership on the potential of AI/ML in delivering transformational value for the enterprise. AI/ML COE maintains and matures BCBSNC AI/ML operations environment, and AI/ML standards & best practices to enable scaling of data science solutions from ideation to prototype, automation, productionization, and integration into business workflows. AI/ML COE also maintains a community of practice for data scientists at BCBSNC and developing partnerships with universities, and other Blues plans.

What You Will Do


Troubleshoot issues related to data pipelines, model predictions, and system integrations.
Provide technical guidance to internal teams and external stakeholders.
Assist in resolving technical challenges related to AI/ML applications.
Assist in optimizing machine learning models for efficiency, accuracy, and scalability.
Monitor performance and health of AI systems and models including identification of anomalies or deviations in model behavior.
Document support processes, troubleshooting steps, and solutions for common issues.
Document deployment processes, configurations, and best practices.
Train end-users on utilizing AI/ML tools effectively.
Work closely with business partners, product managers, and data scientists to ensure that the machine learning models continue to serve their intended purpose.
Support on-going monitoring, tracking, and testing of AI/ML including prototypes and production deployments.


What You Bring


Bachelor's or Advanced Degree where required
5+ Years of Experience
In lieu of degree, 7+ years experience


Salary Range

$100,500.00 - $182,700.00
Show more

title: Consulting Actuary - Medicare Part D
description:
Job Description

This Consulting Actuary with a Medicare Part D focus on the Medicare Pricing team, will provide pricing, forecasting, and strategic support for all Blue Cross NC Medicare products with a particular emphasis on Medicare Part D. You will identify and evaluate risks and strategic opportunities involving Blue Cross NC’s Medicare business through the deployment of actuarial concepts. As a Consulting Actuary you will also provide Medicare thought leadership and assist in the development of go-to-market strategies.


Develop and maintain actuarial models to support the Medicare Advantage Part D bid process
Provide proactive and strategic thought leadership relating but not limited to pharmacy network, formulary, and Medicare Part D topics
Manage relationship with external Pharmacy Benefits Manager as primary point of contact
Experience providing ad-hoc analytic and pricing support for corporate and departmental projects.
Perform actuarial research, experience studies, and statistical analyses using Excel, SQL, SAS, and other tools
Communicate effectively with all levels and divisions within the organization, including Divisional Leadership
Develop and maintain strong business relationships with internal partners through business expertise and exceptional support; act as a strategic advisor
Meet continuing education standards required for job function, thought leadership and maintenance of actuarial credentials.


Hiring Requirements


Bachelor's degree or advanced degree (where required)
Member of the American Academy of Actuaries
Fellow of the Society of Actuaries
7 years of relevant actuarial experience, related experience may be considered.
5 years of relevant Medicare Part D experience
In lieu of an FSA, will consider candidates who are an Associate of the Society of Actuaries (ASA) and have at least 9 years of relevant actuarial experience.


Salary Range

$105,500.00 - $200,500.00
Show more

title: Sr Machine Learning Engineer
description:
Job Description

Blue Cross and Blue Shield of North Carolina has an immediate need for a Senior Machine Learning Engineer.

The ML engineering team plays an integral part in delivering on the enterprise's Data Science MLOps strategy and capabilities. Our ML Engineers will work closely with all Data Scientists to ensure AI/ML models are automated, whether traditional data science, machine learning, or generative AI. This role will be key in GenAI automation on the AWS ecosystem.

The AI/ML COE builds foundational AI/ML capabilities and solutions that serve multiple cross-domain business use cases and provide thought-leadership on the potential of AI/ML in delivering transformational value for the enterprise. AI/ML COE maintains and matures our AI/ML operations environment, and AI/ML standards & best practices to enable scaling of data science solutions from ideation to prototype, automation, productionization, and integration into business workflows. AI/ML COE also maintains a community of practice for data scientists at BCBSNC and developing partnerships with universities, and other Blues plans.

What You Will Do


Define and extract data from multiple sources, integrate disparate data into a common data model, and integrate data into a target database, application, or file using efficient programming processes
Document, and test complex data systems that bring together data from disparate sources, making it available to data scientists, and other users using scripting and/or programming languages
Improve, deploy, and maintain models prepared by Data Scientists into production-grade cloud systems using scalable, efficient machine learning operations pipelines.
Write and refine code to ensure performance and reliability of data extraction and processing
Lead requirements gathering sessions with business and technical staff to distill technical requirement from business requests
Develop advanced SQL queries to extract data for analysis and model construction
Own delivery of large, complex data and ML engineering projects
Design and develop scalable, efficient data pipeline processes to handle data ingestion, cleansing, transformation, integration, and validation required to provide access to prepared data sets to analysts and data scientists
Ensure performance and reliability of data processes
Document and test data processes including performance of through data validation and verification
Collaborate with cross functional team to resolve data quality and operational issues and ensure timely delivery of products
Develop and implement scripts for database and data process maintenance, monitoring, and performance tuning
Analyze and evaluate databases in order to identify and recommend improvements and optimization
Design advanced eye-catching visualizations to convey information to users


What You Bring


Bachelor’s degree and 5 years of experience with Data Warehouses and Data Lakes, Big Data platforms and programming in Python, R or other related language.
Understanding of ML Algorithms, experience creating & executing efficient MLOps pipelines, and tuning ML models
Familiarity with large language models and with implementation of AI solutions in a cloud environment
In lieu of degree, 7 years of the experience as stated above.


Salary Range

$100,500.00 - $182,700.00

title: Enterprise Strategy Consultant
description:
As an Enterprise Strategy Consultant at Blue Cross NC, you’ll develop new and groundbreaking strategies to further our purpose – to make health care better for all – by solving complex challenges that transform health care and have a real impact on the lives of our customers and communities.




The Enterprise Consulting team leads at the intersection of health care and strategy to deliver advisory services across the business. We combine a consulting mindset with deep industry knowledge to develop innovative strategies, transform business models, and deliver cutting-edge capabilities to activate value and drive change across the organization. On this highly visible team, you will work on cross-functional projects with key stakeholders, including senior leaders, to make an impact on enterprise priorities.




When you join our team, you’ll work alongside a group of high performing, dynamic, and collaborative individuals, and use your problem-solving skills to drive critical strategic initiatives to achieve business outcomes. Join us as we disrupt the status quo, challenge current thinking, overturn norms, and pioneer new solutions that effect positive change.




What You'll Do

Drive project work forward and support strategy consulting engagements in alignment with expectations and timelines
Engage with senior team members to understand business needs, advise on strategic business decisions, and develop recommendations and solutions to address complex business challenges
Understand and anticipate key challenges and obstacles, problem solve, and develop strategies to mitigate barriers to project work
Own development of high-quality deliverables (accurate, visually appealing, grammatically correct, logically structured and formatted) such as landscape assessments, strategies, and business cases
Establish positive working relationships with team members and Enterprise Consulting customers to advance project work
Apply a consulting mindset and lens to navigate ambiguous or complex workstreams




What You'll Give

Bachelor's degree or advanced degree (where required)
3+ years of experience in related field.
In lieu of degree, 5+ years of experience in related field.




Bonus Points (preferred qualifications)

3 years of experience in management or strategy consulting
OR Master’s degree and 2 years of experience as stated above.
Experience applying consulting approaches and methodologies and engaging stakeholders
Experience designing, developing, and delivering high-quality deliverables for strategy, enterprise-wide transformation, and/or innovation projects
Strong written and verbal communication skills, including slide design and storyboarding
Ability to take initiative, demonstrate resourcefulness and ingenuity, and execute engagement activities with guidance from senior team members
Possess a deep understanding of the healthcare industry, ecosystem dynamics, and key stakeholders’ needs and priorities
Have direct internal or advisory work experience with healthcare payers
Are a self-starter who can thrive in a fast-paced and challenging environment, and is able to effectively balance multiple priorities
Can identify root causes, understand organizational context and drivers, and effectively communicate findings and recommendations to stakeholders




What You'll Get

We’re so much more than health insurance. At Blue Cross and Blue Shield of North Carolina (Blue Cross NC), we’re committed to making health care better, simpler, and more affordable and have been since 1933. We're driving better health for North Carolina and working to tackle our communities’ greatest health challenges. And we won’t stop until health care is better for all.




When you join our team, you’ll enjoy countless ways to volunteer and support the arts, nonprofit charities, and community programs. Giving back is who we are, and it’s just one of the ways we live our purpose to improve the health and well-being of our customers and communities. Since 2011, our employees have donated more than $11 million to charitable causes and volunteered more than 129,000 hours to support community organizations.




At Blue Cross NC, we have a people-first culture. You’ll have the flexibility to choose where and how you work. Our “Hybrid Flex” approach means you’re empowered to work from anywhere* – fully remote, in the office or a hybrid of the two. We also encourage employees to take care of their well-being with working norms that guide how we work together.




Join a truly great place to work that has the hardware to prove it. We’re consistently recognized by Forbes, Glassdoor, Great Places to Work and other notable organizations for our commitment to our culture, community, work-life flexibility, benefits, diversity and more.




*You may work from any of our approved states.

Show more

title: Sr Business Systems Analyst
description:
Job Description

We are looking for an experienced Contact Center Sr. Business System Analyst to join our already skilled team of experts. You will have a passion for technology and apply it to our high-performance culture. We care deeply about the work we do and the impact it has on our customers. You can take pride in knowing your work has a positive effect on the people of North Carolina.

You’ll be a trusted member of a high energy, tight-knit, creative team. As one of our valued members of the team you will be responsible for the engineering of various and complex aspects of both physical and cloud hosted Contact Center solutions and supporting infrastructures. Using your experience, you will develop and maintain technical standards and procedures for the IT Infrastructure organization in partnership with the Architects, business leads, vendor service providers and IT solution delivery teams as needed. We need for you to be able to analyze operational data, transform and manage business requirements to establish standards for new designs or modifications to existing equipment, systems, or processes. We will look for you to use your interpersonal skills to partner and consult with varied technical, business, project management staff and IT Leaders. We will look for you to leverage your advanced technical knowledge to design, build, deliver and maintain a variety of complex systems and integration.

What You Will Do


Coordinate the planning and development of highly complex engineering designs in support of the implementation of network, compute, telephony, platform, middleware and database solutions.
Own and maintain technology currency and capacity planning in support of established SLAs.
As cross functional, multi-disciplinary infrastructure Contact Center SME, provide expertise and knowledge in emerging technologies with strategic technology vendors.
Provide leadership in software and hardware licensing, financial and capacity activities that plan for the most efficient way to introduce and maintain datacenter technology within the environment.
Proactively provide Contact Center strategy and ongoing consultation for IT and Business Leadership areas as well as vendors affected by the BCBSNS Infrastructure and or Contact Center related applications and infrastructures.
Lead the detailed Contact Center infrastructure design of larger and/or more complex internal projects collaborating with IT stakeholders, service owners and partners.
Provide operational readiness through the engineering, planning, coordination, and delivery of performance and tuning analysis, systems support, incident and problem resolution, software installation, and upgrades.
Maintain appropriate standardized guidelines, work procedures and schedules for solution engineering within the data center environment to expedite workflow and ultimately improve efficiencies.
Build collaborative relationships with the broader IT, business and architecture community to effectively maintain technical roadmaps and provide input into strategies and standards related to area of specialization.
Lead collaboration with vendors on infrastructure designs to ensure the final product is what was architected or designed.
Organize and lead new technology briefings with IT and Enterprise leadership at varied leadership forums.
Provide direction and assistance to less experienced team members and may oversee or coordinate work efforts as needed.


Hiring Preferences


Experience in multiple technical specialties strongly preferred.
Working Experience in the following technologies (Contact Center as a Service (CCaaS), CRM Integration, Genesys, AWS, Call Recording, Storage, Reporting, Private/public carrier services
Proven debugging and high-level technical troubleshooting skills
Exceptional oral and written communication and presentation skills
Ability to effectively manage multiple priorities with excellent organization and planning skillset.
Knowledge of Systems Development Life Cycle Methodologies and process flows.
Ability to correlate technical actions to business impact


Prior Working Experience With


Genesys Administration – Pure Cloud and or Premised based WWE
Development of Interactive Voice Response Systems (IVR)
Implementation of Contact Center Call Routing methods and strategies
Screen Capture and Call Recording
Work force Management tools and Contact Center staffing models
Desktop Computing
Softphone configuration and design
Telecommunications planning and support
SIP Telephony


Hiring Requirements


Bachelor's degree or advanced degree (where required)
8+ years of experience in related field.
In lieu of degree, 10+ years of experience in related field Significant experience and expertise in the following technical specialties: network, compute, storage, telephony, platform, middleware, and/or database.
Experience automating tasks associated with technical specialties.
Experience successfully leading large and/or multi-faceted Contact Center projects and initiatives.


Salary Range

$75,900.00 - $136,600.00
Show more

title: Sr. RPA Developer- UiPath
description:
Job Description

IT is different here. Our work as technology specialists pushes the boundaries of what’s possible in health care. You will build solutions that make a real difference in people’s lives. Driven by the importance of their work, our team members innovate to elevate. We’re encouraged to be curious, collaborate, and turn ideas into solutions that can make health care better for all.

We are seeking highly skilled and experienced senior UiPath RPA Developer to join our team. Responsible for the design, development, testing and support of our complex on premise and cloud-based software, system and/or information solutions. Implement innovative RPA solutions using UiPath and contribute to the development of RPA standards, guidelines, and best practices.

If you are ready to make a career out of making a difference, then you are the person for this team.

What You Will Do


Independently perform the analysis, design and development of high volume, low latency applications for mission critical systems delivering high-availability and performance to best meet customer needs.
Write well designed, testable, efficient code to support varied and more complex IT solutions
Provide strong technical expertise and collaborate with other IT specialists to rapidly develop and deliver stunning solutions that meet changing business needs.
Perform all necessary discovery and fact finding to fully understand more complex business problems and opportunities and independently execute all assignments.
Evaluate options and make solution buy vs. build recommendations to management when requested.
Analyze and recommend solutions to development and production issues while effectively communicating to the project team, applicable vendors and/or the manager in a timely manner.
Research and stay abreast of technology trends and IT best practices, with a focus on continuous learning and possible application to the business.
Provide direction and assistance to less experienced team members.


What You Bring


Bachelor's degree or advanced degree (where required)
5+ years of experience in related field.
In lieu of degree, 7+ years of experience in related field.
.NET experience is preferred


Salary Range

$100,500.00 - $182,700.00

title: Sr Actuarial Analyst
description:
Job Description

The Senior Actuarial Analyst will under general guidance and supervision, applies knowledge of mathematics, probability, statistics, and principles of business in order to provide assistance and technical support for rating/pricing, valuation, healthcare economics and/or financial forecasting. Works with a team of actuaries to assure a coordinated approach to the actuarial components of health programs. Provides actuarial support to Network Management, Underwriting, Sales and Marketing, Finance, and/or Healthcare.


Performs actuarial research, experience studies, and statistical analyses and calculations using Excel, SQL, and SAS.
Calculates premiums, risk scores, and reserves of new and existing plans of insurance.
Provides support to senior analysts or actuaries as required.
Retrieves and validates data for actuarial models. Builds model enhancements and determines reasons for changes to calculated factors. Analyzes impacts of changes to product lines and segments.
Communicates filing status to internal stakeholders and transmits rate filings to regulatory agencies (NCDOI, CMS).
Distributes established reports and responds to inquiries. Investigates trends and anomalies.
Provides analytic support for corporate and departmental projects.


Hiring Requirements


Bachelor's degree or advanced degree (where required)
4+ years of experience in relevant actuarial experience. Related experience may be considered.
Completed at least 5 actuarial exams towards the eventual attainment of the ASA designation.


Preferred Skills And Experience


Strong communication and organization skills


This specific position would focus on providing pricing, forecasting, and strategic support for all Blue Cross NC Medicare products. We are considering candidates at multiple pre-credentialed levels.

Salary Range

$75,900.00 - $136,600.00
Show more

title: Sr. Business Systems Analyst (Pharmacy)
description:
This role is responsible for utilizing strong functional/technical area knowledge and expertise to define, evaluate, and validate requirements, business functional design, and technical design for complex business issues. Acting as a liaison between the Pharmacy departments and IT, the incumbent will develop effective technical solutions to minimize operational and system/application impacts. Key responsibilities include supporting Pharmacy Quality Team initiatives, providing advanced technical support, coordinating ongoing user support, and facilitating projects and initiatives.




What You'll Do

Support Pharmacy Quality Team initiatives and work on Medicare Part D Patient Safety measure gap closure
Provide advanced technical knowledge and support in system/application and procedural issues to the business and IT and help the business find technical solutions to meet their goals.
Use judgment and initiative to review, analyze and develop solutions and applicable business processes for business systems while identifying and quantifying the business impact of those solutions to ensure quality, cost effectiveness, timeliness and customer service, including the resolution of large, complex production system problems.
Provide systems analysis expertise and regularly considers the business implications of the application of technology to the current business environment
Coordinate ongoing user support for ad hoc questions, inquiries, and service requests.
Ensure efficiency of reporting and data tools for supported business area use and for trend analysis.
Coordinate the development of system support processes with IT; coordinate daily to resolve production support issues, including application failures and user errors; document, track and report all system support activities
Work collaboratively on projects and initiatives with the business and IT to test and implement long-term solutions by eliciting and documenting business requirements and preparing appropriate functional specifications while considering technical capabilities of the system/application and ensuring an integrated approach is used.
Act as Business Lead/Coordinator on large, complex departmental and/or some corporate projects/initiatives.
Facilitates project including intake, scheduling of projects, implementation, post-implementation support, and review and approve technical specifications
Serve as point of contact for business testing activities and influence testing strategy to ensures testing will appropriately meet business requirements
Analyze and verify results for accuracy, relevance and completeness. Provide impact assessments and make recommendations to the business owner regarding issues, risks, etc.
Train/coach others on appropriate testing protocol, execution and test plan creation.
Assist IT and help identify business area impacts for hardware and software upgrades, security changes, and architectural enhancements as needed.
Configure and maintain critical system tables and data elements across multiple system environments
Analyze, develop and implement configuration changes to improve system performance and user efficiency
Provide timely and accurate reporting/data on inventory, productivity, user activity, and system performance on a regular and/or as requested basis.
Monitor configuration for accuracy and compliance to change control processes.
Collaborate with pharmacy benefits manager to assess program effectiveness and implement suggested recommendations for improvement when appropriate.
May have budget responsibilities to control expenditures in accordance with budget allocations, together with the conformance to timing, limits and usage of funding as agreed upon in the spending plan for the assigned program.




What You'll Bring (Hiring Requirements)

Bachelor's degree or advanced degree (where required).
5+ years of experience in a related field.
Strong functional/technical area knowledge and expertise with relevant systems/applications.
Ability to define, evaluate, and validate requirements and technical designs for complex business issues.
Experience coordinating with IT to support problem resolution, testing, software upgrades, and related projects.
Proven ability to analyze business systems and identify solutions while considering technical capabilities.
Excellent communication, collaboration, and leadership skills.
Proficiency in MS Excel
Experience in healthcare or pharmacy-related industries is a plus.




Nice to Have (Hiring Preferences)

Medicare knowledge and/or experience
Experience with the following applications/platforms: Salesforce, Care Radius or relevant fulfillment tool (e.g., Blue Connect)

Show more

title: Consulting Actuary - Medicare Part D
description:
This Consulting Actuary with a Medicare Part D focus on the Medicare Pricing team, will provide pricing, forecasting, and strategic support for all Blue Cross NC Medicare products with a particular emphasis on Medicare Part D. You will identify and evaluate risks and strategic opportunities involving Blue Cross NC’s Medicare business through the deployment of actuarial concepts. As a Consulting Actuary you will also provide Medicare thought leadership and assist in the development of go-to-market strategies.




Develop and maintain actuarial models to support the Medicare Advantage Part D bid process
Provide proactive and strategic thought leadership relating but not limited to pharmacy network, formulary, and Medicare Part D topics
Manage relationship with external Pharmacy Benefits Manager as primary point of contact
Experience providing ad-hoc analytic and pricing support for corporate and departmental projects.
Perform actuarial research, experience studies, and statistical analyses using Excel, SQL, SAS, and other tools
Communicate effectively with all levels and divisions within the organization, including Divisional Leadership
Develop and maintain strong business relationships with internal partners through business expertise and exceptional support; act as a strategic advisor
Meet continuing education standards required for job function, thought leadership and maintenance of actuarial credentials.




Hiring Requirement

Bachelor's degree or advanced degree (where required)
Member of the American Academy of Actuaries
Fellow of the Society of Actuaries
7 years of relevant actuarial experience, related experience may be considered.
5 years of relevant Medicare Part D experience.
In lieu of an FSA, will consider candidates who are an Associate of the Society of Actuaries (ASA) and have at least 9 years of relevant actuarial experience
Show more

title: Want to be a Cartographer?
description:
Cartography Biosciences is a therapeutics organization creating the first atlas to identify targets that are specific enough to only engage cancerous cells, broad enough to work across cancer cells and patients, and safe enough to sidestep toxic side effects. Founded by Kevin Parker, Howard Chang, and Ansu Satpathy, Cartography is bridging immunology and computation to understand the critical differences between normal and cancerous cells, ultimately solving the challenge of finding the safest, most selective targets for a variety of immunotherapeutic approaches.

Don't see a current opening that fits your skills, but want to join our team? Please apply here, and include a cover letter that explains the type of roles you'd be interested in!

Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

Cartography Biosciences is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to an inclusive, open working environment and a diverse workplace. People from diverse racial, ethnic and cultural backgrounds, women, LGBTQ+ individuals, and persons with disabilities are highly encouraged to apply. Cartography is also committed to providing employees with opportunities for growth and skill acquisition. As a Cartographer, you will be exposed to cutting-edge molecular biology and computational methods development and have opportunities to learn, grow, and diversify your skillset.

description:
About the job

About Solera

Solera is changing lives by guiding people to better health solutions that work. Solera’s value-based technology platform enables successful interventions that address the most prevalent and costly chronic conditions. Solera matches consumers to their best-fit solution within carefully curated networks of digital and community-based point solutions and drives superior engagement and outcomes by managing performance. Solera’s technology platform serves payers and employers by streamlining, integrating, and creating accountability in the point solution ecosystem.




About the Role

We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Senior Data Analyst to join our dynamic Data Engineering team. In this role, you will leverage your advanced SQL expertise to analyze intricate datasets, deriving actionable insights that drive our data-driven initiatives forward. This fully remote position within the United States offers autonomy alongside collaboration with diverse, cross-functional teams. If you thrive in healthcare payor data analysis, excel in client interactions, and enjoy working independently, we encourage you to apply and contribute to our innovative projects.




Key Responsibilities

Data Analysis and SQL Expertise: Utilize your extensive SQL experience to analyze and interpret complex datasets.
Mapping and Testing Specifications: Lead the development and documentation of mapping specifications based on extensive data files and test case scenarios. Ensure accuracy and consistency in data transformation processes.
Healthcare Payor Data: Apply your expertise in healthcare payor data to extract meaningful insights and support data-driven decision-making.
Client Interaction: Engage directly with clients to understand their requirements, provide data insights, and effectively communicate technical concepts. Build and maintain strong client relationships.
Independence and Initiative: Proactively solve problems, take ownership of tasks, and deliver high-quality results with minimal supervision.
Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams, particularly data engineers, to enhance our data practices and contribute to ongoing data-related projects.




Requirements

Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field strongly preferred.
Minimum 5+ years of professional experience with SQL. Proficient in writing complex queries, optimizing performance, ensuring data accuracy, and manipulating large datasets.
Specific experience in analyzing healthcare payor data (e.g., claims, eligibility data).
Experience in working directly with raw data, including cleaning, transforming, and preparing it for analysis.
Led or participated in data meetings with clients or data vendors, discussing requirements, data quality, and solutions.
Experience in analyzing data files, identifying gaps in data fields or inconsistencies, and proposing solutions.
Proficiency in documenting data mappings from source to target systems, ensuring clarity and accuracy in data transformation processes
Skills in data cleansing techniques, creating reports, and visualizing data to communicate insights effectively.
Understanding of different data types, encoding methods, and their impact on data analysis and storage.




Preferred Qualifications

Experience with Google BigQuery or similar cloud-based data warehousing solutions.
Understanding of healthcare industry activities, trends, and regulations (e.g., HIPAA).
Experience in leadership or management roles, leading teams or projects.
Previous experience working in a startup environment, dealing with rapid growth and dynamic challenges.
Familiarity with Microsoft Azure cloud platform and its data services.
Familiarity with Python for data analysis.




Where you are located

This is a remote position based in the United States. Occasional travel (5%) may be required for business purposes.




Benefits

Remote-first work environment
Competitive salary and compensation package
Flexible paid time off
Paid maternity and paternity leave
Adoption assistance program
Comprehensive medical, dental, and vision insurance
13 paid company holidays
401k retirement plan with company match
Complimentary FitBit, Sworkit, and Headspace accounts




Disclaimer

The information contained herein is not intended to be an all-inclusive list of the duties and responsibilities of the job, nor are they intended to be an all-inclusive list of the skills and abilities required to do the job. Management may, at its discretion, assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time.




EEO

Solera Health provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, Solera Health complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

About the job

About the Company

Solera is changing lives by guiding people to better health solutions that work. Solera’s value-based technology platform enables successful interventions that address the most prevalent and costly chronic conditions. Solera matches consumers to their best-fit solution within carefully curated networks of digital and community-based point solutions and drives superior engagement and outcomes by managing performance. Solera’s technology platform serves payers and employers by streamlining, integrating, and creating accountability in the point solution ecosystem.




About the Role

As a Compliance Manager at Solera Health, you will play a pivotal role in advancing our compliance initiatives and ensuring adherence to regulatory requirements. You will lead and support various projects to enhance Solera’s Compliance Program, collaborating closely with stakeholders across the organization to integrate compliance strategies with business objectives effectively.




Essential Roles and Responsibilities

Update Compliance Program: Modify the Compliance Program in response to changes in regulations or business operations.
Stakeholder Collaboration: Foster strong relationships with key leaders, understanding business priorities to align and integrate compliance programs across departments.
Audit Support: Assist the Director of Compliance in conducting internal and external audits, ensuring timely completion and guiding corrective actions.
Compliance Issue Resolution: Maintain the Compliance Complaint log, overseeing prompt investigation and resolution of compliance issues.
Metrics and Reporting: Develop and monitor compliance metrics, preparing insightful reports for Senior Management.
Risk Assessment: Conduct periodic reviews to assess compliance risk and evaluate the effectiveness of compliance controls.
Policy Development: Draft, review, and update compliance policies and procedures to address regulatory changes and business needs.
Communication and Presentation: Prepare presentations for the Compliance Committee, effectively communicating key insights.
Regulatory Awareness: Stay informed about changes in regulations and industry best practices, proactively communicating updates to relevant stakeholders.




Expected Skills and Competencies

Solid understanding of laws, regulations, and industry standards in Healthcare, Health Tech, or Health Services sectors.
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment while managing multiple priorities and deadlines.
Self-driven with strong autonomy and excellent communication skills.
Detail-oriented with robust organizational and project management abilities.
Strong problem-solving skills, making data-driven decisions aligned with regulatory guidelines.
Proficiency in analyzing complex regulations and developing practical compliance strategies.




Education and Qualifications

Bachelor's Degree in Business Administration, Law, or related field; Advanced degree preferred.
Certification in Healthcare Compliance (e.g., CHC, CCEP, HCCP, or similar) is advantageous.
Minimum 3-5 years of experience in compliance and audit roles, with a significant focus on Healthcare Compliance and/or Health Tech solutions and platforms.
In-depth knowledge of healthcare regulations such as HIPAA and GDPR.
Proven track record in managing internal and external audits.




Supervisory Responsibilities

This role may involve overseeing a Compliance Analyst in the future.




Location

This is a fully remote position in the United States.




Benefits

Remote-first work environment
Competitive salary and compensation package
Flexible paid time off
Paid maternity and paternity leave
Adoption assistance program
Comprehensive medical, dental, and vision insurance
13 paid company holidays
401k retirement plan with company match
Complimentary FitBit, Sworkit, and Headspace accounts

description:
About the job

As an Enterprise Strategy Senior Consultant, you’ll develop new and groundbreaking strategies to further our purpose – to make health care better for all – by solving complex challenges that transform health care and have a real impact on the lives of our customers and communities.




The Enterprise Consulting team leads at the intersection of health care and strategy to deliver advisory services across the business. We combine a consulting mindset with deep industry knowledge to develop innovative strategies, transform business models, and deliver cutting-edge capabilities to activate value and drive change across the organization. On this highly visible team, you will work on cross-functional projects with key stakeholders, including senior leaders, to make an impact on enterprise priorities.




When you join our team, you’ll work alongside a group of high performing, dynamic, and collaborative individuals, and use your problem-solving skills to drive critical strategic initiatives to achieve business outcomes. Join us as we disrupt the status quo, challenge current thinking, overturn norms, and pioneer new solutions that effect positive change.




What You’ll Do

Drive project work forward and support strategy consulting engagements in alignment with expectations and timelines
Engage with senior team members to understand business needs, and define and provide recommendations to advance workstreams
Identify challenges and trend drivers across the healthcare ecosystem, distill complex information into key takeaways, understand organizational context, and effectively communicate findings and recommendations to stakeholders
Understand and anticipate key challenges and obstacles, problem solve, and develop strategies to mitigate barriers to project work
Lead development of high-quality deliverables (accurate, visually appealing, grammatically correct, logically structured and formatted) such as landscape assessments, strategies, and business cases
Establish positive working relationships with team members and Enterprise Consulting customers to advance project work
Apply a consulting mindset and lens to navigate ambiguous or complex workstreams




What You’ll Need To Succeed

Bachelor's degree or advanced degree (where required)
5+ years of experience in related field.
In lieu of degree, 7+ years of experience in related field.




What We Like (preferred Qualifications)

5+ years of experience in management or strategy consulting
Experience applying consulting approaches and methodologies and engaging stakeholders
Experience designing, developing, and delivering high-quality deliverables for strategy, enterprise-wide transformation, and/or innovation projects
Strong written and verbal communication skills, including slide design and storyboarding
Ability to take initiative, demonstrate resourcefulness and ingenuity, and execute engagement activities with guidance from leadership as needed
Possess a deep understanding of the healthcare industry, ecosystem dynamics, and key stakeholders’ needs and priorities
Have direct internal or advisory work experience with healthcare payers
Are a self-starter who can thrive in a fast-paced and challenging environment, and is able to effectively balance multiple priorities




About Life at Blue Cross NC

We’re so much more than health insurance. At Blue Cross and Blue Shield of North Carolina (Blue Cross NC), we’re committed to making health care better, simpler, and more affordable and have been since 1933. We're driving better health for North Carolina and working to tackle our communities’ greatest health challenges. And we won’t stop until health care is better for all.




When you join our team, you’ll enjoy countless ways to volunteer and support the arts, nonprofit charities, and community programs. Giving back is who we are, and it’s just one of the ways we live our purpose to improve the health and well-being of our customers and communities. Since 2011, our employees have donated more than $11 million to charitable causes and volunteered more than 129,000 hours to support community organizations.




At Blue Cross NC, we have a people-first culture. You’ll have the flexibility to choose where and how you work. Our “Hybrid Flex” approach means you’re empowered to work from anywhere* – fully remote, in the office or a hybrid of the two. We also encourage employees to take care of their well-being with working norms that guide how we work together.




Join a truly great place to work that has the hardware to prove it. We’re consistently recognized by Forbes, Glassdoor, Great Places to Work and other notable organizations for our commitment to our culture, community, work-life flexibility, benefits, diversity and more.

description:
About the job

As an Enterprise Strategy Consultant at Blue Cross NC, you’ll develop new and groundbreaking strategies to further our purpose – to make health care better for all – by solving complex challenges that transform health care and have a real impact on the lives of our customers and communities.




The Enterprise Consulting team leads at the intersection of health care and strategy to deliver advisory services across the business. We combine a consulting mindset with deep industry knowledge to develop innovative strategies, transform business models, and deliver cutting-edge capabilities to activate value and drive change across the organization. On this highly visible team, you will work on cross-functional projects with key stakeholders, including senior leaders, to make an impact on enterprise priorities. 




When you join our team, you’ll work alongside a group of high performing, dynamic, and collaborative individuals, and use your problem-solving skills to drive critical strategic initiatives to achieve business outcomes. Join us as we disrupt the status quo, challenge current thinking, overturn norms, and pioneer new solutions that effect positive change.




What You'll Do

Drive project work forward and support strategy consulting engagements in alignment with expectations and timelines
Engage with senior team members to understand business needs, advise on strategic business decisions, and develop recommendations and solutions to address complex business challenges
Understand and anticipate key challenges and obstacles, problem solve, and develop strategies to mitigate barriers to project work
Own development of high-quality deliverables (accurate, visually appealing, grammatically correct, logically structured and formatted) such as landscape assessments, strategies, and business cases
Establish positive working relationships with team members and Enterprise Consulting customers to advance project work
Apply a consulting mindset and lens to navigate ambiguous or complex workstreams




What You'll Give

Bachelor's degree or advanced degree (where required)
3+ years of experience in related field.
In lieu of degree, 5+ years of experience in related field.




Bonus Points (preferred qualifications)

3 years of experience in management or strategy consulting
OR Master’s degree and 2 years of experience as stated above.
Experience applying consulting approaches and methodologies and engaging stakeholders
Experience designing, developing, and delivering high-quality deliverables for strategy, enterprise-wide transformation, and/or innovation projects
Strong written and verbal communication skills, including slide design and storyboarding
Ability to take initiative, demonstrate resourcefulness and ingenuity, and execute engagement activities with guidance from senior team members
Possess a deep understanding of the healthcare industry, ecosystem dynamics, and key stakeholders’ needs and priorities
Have direct internal or advisory work experience with healthcare payers
Are a self-starter who can thrive in a fast-paced and challenging environment, and is able to effectively balance multiple priorities
Can identify root causes, understand organizational context and drivers, and effectively communicate findings and recommendations to stakeholders




What You'll Get

We’re so much more than health insurance. At Blue Cross and Blue Shield of North Carolina (Blue Cross NC), we’re committed to making health care better, simpler, and more affordable and have been since 1933. We're driving better health for North Carolina and working to tackle our communities’ greatest health challenges. And we won’t stop until health care is better for all.




When you join our team, you’ll enjoy countless ways to volunteer and support the arts, nonprofit charities, and community programs. Giving back is who we are, and it’s just one of the ways we live our purpose to improve the health and well-being of our customers and communities. Since 2011, our employees have donated more than $11 million to charitable causes and volunteered more than 129,000 hours to support community organizations.




At Blue Cross NC, we have a people-first culture. You’ll have the flexibility to choose where and how you work. Our “Hybrid Flex” approach means you’re empowered to work from anywhere* – fully remote, in the office or a hybrid of the two. We also encourage employees to take care of their well-being with working norms that guide how we work together.




Join a truly great place to work that has the hardware to prove it. We’re consistently recognized by Forbes, Glassdoor, Great Places to Work and other notable organizations for our commitment to our culture, community, work-life flexibility, benefits, diversity and more.




*You may work from any of our approved states.

description:
About the job

This role supports Blue Cross NC’s corporate pharmacy program through member-focused formulary design, sales team support, benefit plan creation, program development and more. This department collaborates on innovative solutions with its pharmacy benefit manager Prime Therapeutics (Prime) and other strategic partners to deliver significant value through improved health outcomes, greater savings, and seamless member experience.




What You'll Do:




Master understanding of ASO pharmacy pricing concepts and strategies.
Deliver comprehensive pharmacy support and expertise to the sales team
Develop pharmacy broker and consultant relationships specific to the pharmacy business.
Collaborate closely with the PBM sales team to develop strategies, identify opportunities, and drive sales initiatives
Effectively communicate our pharmacy offerings.
Support and manage development efforts related to the enhancement and maintenance of our current products and market offer components.
Analyze and monitor industry, regulatory, technology, and market-based trends that affect our ability to maintain a competitive pharmacy offer.
Present information from established relationships to help us compete effectively in the marketplace, including insights on how specific consultants evaluate RFP responses and value our pharmacy proposals.
Collaborate with and support other departments across the enterprise on common initiatives and unique ventures, as directed.
Support efforts for operational improvements with new analysis/reporting capabilities, project management techniques, and/or consulting/engagement approaches.




What You'll Bring (Hiring Requirements):




Bachelor's degree or advanced degree (where required).
3+ years of experience in a related field, or in lieu of a degree, 5+ years of experience in a related field.
Local travel is expected in market areas within North Carolina as determined by business needs.




Nice to Have (Hiring Preferences):




Demonstrated pharmacy experience.
Demonstrated experience working with brokers and/or consultants in a healthcare or pharmacy environment.
