description:
About the job

This role is responsible for utilizing strong functional/technical area knowledge and expertise to define, evaluate, and validate requirements, business functional design, and technical design for complex business issues. Acting as a liaison between the Pharmacy departments and IT, the incumbent will develop effective technical solutions to minimize operational and system/application impacts. Key responsibilities include supporting Pharmacy Quality Team initiatives, providing advanced technical support, coordinating ongoing user support, and facilitating projects and initiatives.




What You'll Do

Support Pharmacy Quality Team initiatives and work on Medicare Part D Patient Safety measure gap closure
Provide advanced technical knowledge and support in system/application and procedural issues to the business and IT and help the business find technical solutions to meet their goals.
Use judgment and initiative to review, analyze and develop solutions and applicable business processes for business systems while identifying and quantifying the business impact of those solutions to ensure quality, cost effectiveness, timeliness and customer service, including the resolution of large, complex production system problems.
Provide systems analysis expertise and regularly considers the business implications of the application of technology to the current business environment
Coordinate ongoing user support for ad hoc questions, inquiries, and service requests.
Ensure efficiency of reporting and data tools for supported business area use and for trend analysis. 
Coordinate the development of system support processes with IT; coordinate daily to resolve production support issues, including application failures and user errors; document, track and report all system support activities
Work collaboratively on projects and initiatives with the business and IT to test and implement long-term solutions by eliciting and documenting business requirements and preparing appropriate functional specifications while considering technical capabilities of the system/application and ensuring an integrated approach is used.
Act as Business Lead/Coordinator on large, complex departmental and/or some corporate projects/initiatives. 
Facilitates project including intake, scheduling of projects, implementation, post-implementation support, and review and approve technical specifications
Serve as point of contact for business testing activities and influence testing strategy to ensures testing will appropriately meet business requirements
Analyze and verify results for accuracy, relevance and completeness. Provide impact assessments and make recommendations to the business owner regarding issues, risks, etc. 
Train/coach others on appropriate testing protocol, execution and test plan creation. 
Assist IT and help identify business area impacts for hardware and software upgrades, security changes, and architectural enhancements as needed.
Configure and maintain critical system tables and data elements across multiple system environments
Analyze, develop and implement configuration changes to improve system performance and user efficiency
Provide timely and accurate reporting/data on inventory, productivity, user activity, and system performance on a regular and/or as requested basis.
Monitor configuration for accuracy and compliance to change control processes.
Collaborate with pharmacy benefits manager to assess program effectiveness and implement suggested recommendations for improvement when appropriate.
May have budget responsibilities to control expenditures in accordance with budget allocations, together with the conformance to timing, limits and usage of funding as agreed upon in the spending plan for the assigned program.




What You'll Bring (Hiring Requirements)

Bachelor's degree or advanced degree (where required).
5+ years of experience in a related field.
Strong functional/technical area knowledge and expertise with relevant systems/applications.
Ability to define, evaluate, and validate requirements and technical designs for complex business issues.
Experience coordinating with IT to support problem resolution, testing, software upgrades, and related projects.
Proven ability to analyze business systems and identify solutions while considering technical capabilities.
Excellent communication, collaboration, and leadership skills.
Proficiency in MS Excel
Experience in healthcare or pharmacy-related industries is a plus.




Nice to Have (Hiring Preferences)

Medicare knowledge and/or experience
Experience with the following applications/platforms: Salesforce, Care Radius or relevant fulfillment tool (e.g., Blue Connect)

About the job
Job Description

IT is different here. Our work as technology specialists pushes the boundaries of what’s possible in health care. You will build solutions that make a real difference in people’s lives. Driven by the importance of their work, our team members innovate to elevate. We’re encouraged to be curious, collaborate, and turn ideas into solutions that can make health care better for all.

We are seeking highly skilled and experienced senior UiPath RPA Developer to join our team. Responsible for the design, development, testing and support of our complex on premise and cloud-based software, system and/or information solutions. If you are ready to make a career out of making a difference, then you are the person for this team.

description:
About the job
Job Description

IT is different here. Our work as technology specialists pushes the boundaries of what’s possible in health care. You will build solutions that make a real difference in people’s lives. Driven by the importance of their work, our team members innovate to elevate. We’re encouraged to be curious, collaborate, and turn ideas into solutions that can make health care better for all.

In this role you will serve as the Senior AI/ML scientist to identify, research, and develop transformational predictive, prescriptive, and Generative AI (GenAI) solutions that translate structured and unstructured data into sound organizational decisions. Senior AI/ML scientist will combine statistical expertise, programming skills, and data science knowledge to create impactful self-learning applications and collaborate with multidisciplinary teams to integrate AI technologies into real-world systems and solutions to achieve business goals.

The AI/ML COE builds foundational AI/ML capabilities and solutions that serve multiple cross-domain business use cases and provide thought-leadership on the potential of AI/ML in delivering transformational value for the enterprise. AI/ML COE maintains and matures BCBSNC AI/ML operations environment, and AI/ML standards & best practices to enable scaling of data science solutions from ideation to prototype, automation, productionization, and integration into business workflows. AI/ML COE also maintains a community of practice for data scientists at BCBSNC and developing partnerships with universities, and other Blues plans.

What You Will Do


Own delivery of large and/or complex machine learning (ML), deep learning (DL), and Generative AI (GenAI) systems with self-learning capabilities that can adapt and evolve over time.
Design, implement, and evaluate artificial intelligence (AI) systems that can be used in production environments to meet business needs.
Apply prescriptive analytics techniques such as optimization, recommendation systems, and reinforcement learning to business problems.
Lead in the development and testing of appropriate ML algorithms, design & conduct experiments, collect and analyze data, and optimize performance of ML algorithms.
Stay updated with the advancements in artificial intelligence, machine learning, and generative AI methods and adapt new methods to effectively solve business problems.
Benchmark against existing machine learning methods and analyze results to identify strengths, weaknesses, and areas for improvement.
Develop prototypes and proof-of-concept implementations to demonstrate the feasibility and potential of new AI technologies including Generative AI.
Lead consultation sessions with business partners to distill the business needs and provide technical guidance on predictive and prescriptive AI approaches, ensuring alignment with business goals.
Drive continuous improvement by experimenting with novel techniques and refining existing models.
Leverage deep knowledge of software engineering principles in constructing sophisticated ML models and refining existing systems.
Identify actionable insights, suggest recommendations, and influence business direction by effectively communicating results to cross functional groups.

description:
About the job

Job Description

As a Clinical Coding Analyst, you will provide technical, clinical and coding expertise to support coding related projects. Consults/collaborates with all plan areas regarding national coding standards and applicability to BCBSNC claims processing systems and reimbursement policy. Presents findings and trends in coding practices to internal/external audiences and makes recommendations regarding coding standards.




What You'll Do

Provide consultative expertise to other areas (e.g. Compliance, Claims Operations, Legal, Network Management, third party vendors and Medical Policy) regarding current and emerging coding/documentation issues.
Develop policies and standard operating procedures for the Healthcare division, which impact multiple business areas to ensure compliance with regulatory agencies, state and federal law and ensure consistency of reviews and operations.
Obtain and maintain all Clinical Code sets as issued from CMS, AMA and ADA.
Collaborate with multiple business areas to determine & ensure proper coding logic in the claims processing systems, based on member benefits & existing guidelines
Acts as a knowledge resource to pricing & expense analyst regarding charge/pricing related issues, providing processing and programming recommendation
Identify trends in coding practices to internal/external audiences and make recommendations regarding coding standards.
Assimilate necessary documentation, including medical records, and apply clinical coding expertise to evaluate appropriateness of provider coding and assess medical necessity of services rendered with referral to Medical Director as appropriate.
Gather appropriate claims data, analyze and prepare summary of analysis to assist in the development of resource allocation strategies to meet changing business needs.
Respond to internal and external inquiries regarding specific medical procedure coding issues and provide education on proper coding techniques via written and/or telephonic communications.
Develop educational materials for providers identified as outliers and collaborate with Network Management on delivery/communication of information to provider.
Maintain documents for tracking audit results, status/outcomes of reviews etc.
Participate in or lead special projects based on business area needs requiring independent, sound decision making and broad based understanding of impact on the individual department as well as impact on corporate objectives.




What You'll Bring (Hiring Requirements)

RN or LPN with a valid NC license
3+ years of experience in related field
If LPN, 7+ years of experience in related field
Certified Professional Coder
Special Investigations Unit experience preferred

description:
About the job

This specific position would focus on providing pricing, forecasting, and strategic support for all Blue Cross NC Medicare products. We are considering candidates at multiple pre-credentialed levels.




The Senior Actuarial Analyst will under general guidance and supervision, applies knowledge of mathematics, probability, statistics, and principles of business in order to provide assistance and technical support for rating/pricing, valuation, healthcare economics and/or financial forecasting. Works with a team of actuaries to assure a coordinated approach to the actuarial components of health programs. Provides actuarial support to Network Management, Underwriting, Sales and Marketing, Finance, and/or Healthcare.

Performs actuarial research, experience studies, and statistical analyses and calculations using Excel, SQL, and SAS.
Calculates premiums, risk scores, and reserves of new and existing plans of insurance.
Provides support to senior analysts or actuaries as required.
Retrieves and validates data for actuarial models. Builds model enhancements and determines reasons for changes to calculated factors. Analyzes impacts of changes to product lines and segments.
Communicates filing status to internal stakeholders and transmits rate filings to regulatory agencies (NCDOI, CMS).
Distributes established reports and responds to inquiries. Investigates trends and anomalies.
Provides analytic support for corporate and departmental projects.




Hiring Requirements

Bachelor's degree or advanced degree
4+ years of relevant actuarial experience. Related experience may be considered.
Must have completed at least 5 exams towards the eventual attainment of the ASA designation.




Preferred Skills and Experience

Strong communication and organization skills
Strong technical, data, and coding skills
Ability to think creatively and strategically, leveraging business knowledge to drive change and mitigate risks.
Adaptive and versatile learner, with ability to react quickly to changing business dynamics.

About the job
Job Description

Blue Cross and Blue Shield of North Carolina has an immediate need for a Senior Support Engineer who will bolster our growing Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning (AI/ML) practice.

As a Generative AI support engineer, you will collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate AI solutions into the business workflows, ensuring they meet user needs and business objectives. You will also be responsible for designing, optimizing, and evaluating prompts to enhance the performance of large language models and AI systems.

The AI/ML COE builds foundational AI/ML capabilities and solutions that serve multiple cross-domain business use cases and provide thought-leadership on the potential of AI/ML in delivering transformational value for the enterprise. Assist in the development and testing of Generative AI applications by crafting specific context-aware prompts for health insurance related topics.
Collaborate with domain experts to ensure prompts align with industry standards and regulations to ensure that the AI-generated content is accurate, free from bias, and compliant.
Work closely with business partners, product managers, and data scientists to ensure that the AI-generated content meets quality standards and serves its intended purpose.

description:
About the job
Job Description

Blue Cross and Blue Shield of North Carolina has an immediate need for a governance program support analyst to support our growing Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning (AI/ML) governance program and the Principal Analyst who functions as BCNC’s primary focal point for AI/ML Strategy, Governance, & Risk Mgmt./Compliance.

In this position you will provide key programmatic support to include tracking myriad policy implementation tasks, governance actions, and compliance monitoring activities. Due to the cross-disciplinary equities of AI/ML, this position will also work closely with Enterprise Security, Privacy & Compliance, Legal, Vendor Mgmt., and Training teams, among others.

The AI/ML COE builds foundational AI/ML capabilities and solutions that serve multiple cross-domain business use cases and provide thought-leadership on the potential of AI/ML in delivering transformational value for the enterprise. AI/ML COE maintains and matures our AI/ML operations environment, and AI/ML standards & best practices to enable scaling of data science solutions from ideation to prototype, automation, productionization, and integration into business workflows. AI/ML COE also maintains a community of practice for data scientists at BCBSNC and developing partnerships with universities, and other Blues plans.

What You Will Do


Assist the Principal in tracking AI/ML-related legislation, policy, regulation, & industry standards and creating implementation plans/roadmaps
Assist the Principal in establishing and implementing our AI/ML governance and AI/ML risk management frameworks and take the lead on tasking and tracking related actions to ensure completion
Assist the Principal in performing risk evaluations of AI/ML activities and take the lead on documenting deficiencies, monitoring mitigations, and providing program metrics. 
Take the lead in tracking AI/ML-related vendor actions—to include contract language disputes/drafts & vendor AI/ML assessment results-- and ensure they are tasked and completed by the appropriate SME
Help the Principal to establish notification processes where required by policy and regulation and take the lead in monitoring those processes and providing metrics, where appropriate
Assist the Principal in developing AI/ML-related governance/compliance training content and take the lead on integrating it into existing company-wide training efforts, where feasible
Establish and maintain a company-wide website/collaboration space that explains AI/ML governance rules, processes, and FAQs
Support governance forums as needed to include creating agendas, tracking action items for completion, and taking official minutes


What You Bring


 Bachelor's degree or advanced degree (where required)
 0-2 years of experience in related field.
 In lieu of degree, 2+ years of experience in related field.


Preferred Experience


Ability to take a document or tasking and correctly discern which subject areas/organizational equities are affected
Experience supporting a governance body or working group, to include taking minutes.
Experience breaking down a policy into actionable requirements
Experience with creating new processes
Successful experience working in a heavily matrixed organization.
Some familiarity with topics related to Artificial Intelligence including Machine Learning, Generative AI, LLMs, etc., and a high-level working knowledge of how they fit together
Ability to create own structure and work successfully in a business area with constantly evolving requirements and leadership scrutiny 
Experience leading the administrative aspects of a cross-disciplinary program or effort, to include metrics, action tracking, and communication
Experience developing high-quality written documentation, to include project milestones
Strong organizational skills

description:
About the job
Job Description

Blue Cross and Blue Shield of North Carolina has an immediate need for a Senior Machine Learning Engineer.

The ML engineering team plays an integral part in delivering on the enterprise's Data Science MLOps strategy and capabilities. Our ML Engineers will work closely with all Data Scientists to ensure AI/ML models are automated, whether traditional data science, machine learning, or generative AI. This role will be key in GenAI automation on the AWS ecosystem.

The AI/ML COE builds foundational AI/ML capabilities and solutions that serve multiple cross-domain business use cases and provide thought-leadership on the potential of AI/ML in delivering transformational value for the enterprise. AI/ML COE maintains and matures our AI/ML operations environment, and AI/ML standards & best practices to enable scaling of data science solutions from ideation to prototype, automation, productionization, and integration into business workflows. AI/ML COE also maintains a community of practice for data scientists at BCBSNC and developing partnerships with universities, and other Blues plans.

What You Will Do


Define and extract data from multiple sources, integrate disparate data into a common data model, and integrate data into a target database, application, or file using efficient programming processes
Document, and test complex data systems that bring together data from disparate sources, making it available to data scientists, and other users using scripting and/or programming languages
Improve, deploy, and maintain models prepared by Data Scientists into production-grade cloud systems using scalable, efficient machine learning operations pipelines.
Write and refine code to ensure performance and reliability of data extraction and processing
Lead requirements gathering sessions with business and technical staff to distill technical requirement from business requests
Develop advanced SQL queries to extract data for analysis and model construction
Own delivery of large, complex data and ML engineering projects

Ensure performance and reliability of data processes
Document and test data processes including performance of through data validation and verification
Collaborate with cross functional team to resolve data quality and operational issues and ensure timely delivery of products
Develop and implement scripts for database and data process maintenance, monitoring, and performance tuning
Analyze and evaluate databases in order to identify and recommend improvements and optimization
Design advanced eye-catching visualizations to convey information to users


What You Bring


Bachelor’s degree and 5 years of experience with Data Warehouses and Data Lakes, Big Data platforms and programming in Python, R or other related language.

description:
About the job
Job Description

Support the development and maintenance of a high performing quality provider network by engaging with Accountable Care Organizations (ACOs) and independent primary care providers to promote quality improvement for NCQA Healthcare Effectiveness and Data Information Set (HEDIS) measures, MA Stars and developing improvement plans when needed. Implement and manage all Quality Management activities for assigned providers. Work closely with relevant Blue Cross NC stakeholders to educate providers regarding quality management and preventive health initiatives and programs.

What You'll Do


Some onsite clinical practice visits required (East: Wilmington area and West: Asheville area).
Maintain a collaborative working relationship with assigned providers to streamline processes related to Healthcare Effectiveness Data and Information Set (HEDIS) measures to maximize outcomes of NCQA accreditation, Medicare Stars, HEDIS Measure performance and improve provider satisfaction.
Provides guidance with interpretation of clinical aspects of Corporate Medical Policy and HEDIS Measures, develops, and implements quality improvement plans based on departmental goals. Aligns clinical decision-making processes with regulatory requirements (e.g., DOI/ERISA/NCQA). Keeps abreast of medical knowledge, care patterns, regulatory and governmental rules, and regulations.
Provides education and supports implementation of Blue Cross NC quality-based programs ensuring care cap closure (including HEDIS medical record abstraction) to improve member outcomes. Programs include but not limited to: Blue Premier and Medicare Advantage Quality Incentive Program (MAQIP).
Utilize data analysis and visualization tools to create presentations, providing relevant and actionable feedback to providers in monthly quality workstream meetings in collaboration with internal quality teams and external stakeholders.
Assists in the evaluation, development, and integration of Quality Management programs in support of new corporate initiatives. Participate in change efforts and promotes department, division, and corporate goals.
Collects, organizes, and disseminates “best practices” information regarding providers operating within Value Based Programs. Supports the development of continuous quality improvement activities.
Provides local presence for Quality Management (QM) related activities.

RN with 3 years of clinical experience or LPN with 5 years of clinical experience required.
Must have previous work experience in applicable business area (i.e., UM, CM, Medical Review or quality programs)
Bachelor’s degree or advanced degree preferred.

Experience with HEDIS Clinical measures data extraction strongly preferred.
Previous experience with clinical quality improvement preferred.

description:
About the job
Job Description

Blue Cross and Blue Shield of North Carolina has an immediate need for an experienced governance or change management professional who understands at a strategic level Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning (AI/ML) and who can immediately take the lead to formalize and implement our AI/ML governance strategy and protocols across all areas of business. This role will serve as our AI/ML governance focal point and will play a leading role in helping us continue to safely move forward in the AI/ML space.

In this position you will serve as a bridge between Data Governance and AI/ML business areas and will function as a primary focal point for AI/ML Strategy, Governance, & Risk Management/Compliance. Due to the cross-disciplinary equities of AI, this position will also work closely Enterprise Security, Privacy & Compliance, Legal, Vendor Mgmt., and Training teams, among others.

The AI/ML COE builds foundational AI/ML capabilities and solutions that serve multiple cross-domain business use cases and provide thought-leadership on the potential of AI/ML in delivering transformational value for the enterprise.

AI/ML COE maintains and matures BCBSNC AI/ML operations environment, and AI/ML standards & best practices to enable scaling of data science solutions from ideation to prototype, automation, productionization, and integration into business workflows. AI/ML COE also maintains a community of practice for data scientists at BCBSNC and developing partnerships with universities, and other Blues plans.

What You Will Do

AI Governance Strategy:


Work closely with our AI/ML leaders and practitioners to codify and implement ethical guidelines for AI/ML use and to create a cohesive AI/ML use, governance, & oversight strategy that aligns to BCNC’s corporate strategy and vision.


AI/ML Governance/Risk/Compliance


Develop and implement an AI/ML governance framework & RACI while ensuring data integrity, security, compliance with regulatory standards, and responsible use of AI/ML technologies.
Support the internal governance/approval processes for ML models and support BCNC governance bodies/forums, as appropriate
Take the lead in establishing oversight processes to guide data collection, use, and management for AI and Generative AI tools and technologies and establish appropriate monitoring and associated compliance activities.
Create and implement a roadmap for performing ongoing AI/ML Risk Management and adjust as necessary to ensure all AI/ML within the organization adheres to BCNC’s risk management culture.
Proactively advise cross-disciplinary partners on applicable AI/ML risk and governance standards, including keeping up to date with developments in the applicable laws, rules, standards and industry practices, and recommend mitigations as appropriate.


AI/ML Policy/Regulatory SME


Serve as a primary thought leader to assess the impacts of new AI/ML-related policies/regulations and serve as the primary focal point for implementation.
Serve as the primary SME providing guidance to legal and vendor management on the AI/ML-related contract language and data agreements related to vendor use of AI/ML technology in alignment with federal and industry standards.
Participate in industry & Blue Cross Association forums to keep abreast of ever-changing laws and regulations as it relates to AI/ML.
Establish and monitor all required reporting and notification processes necessary to meet AI/ML regulatory, company, and industry/licensing requirements.


Training


Take a leading role in establishing training protocols to address legal, regulatory, and fairness considerations associated with AI/ML tools and technology.
Provide ad-hoc briefings and information sessions as necessary to socialize AI/ML governance practices and raise workforce awareness.


What You Bring


Bachelor's degree or advanced degree (where required)
8+ years of experience in related field
In lieu of degree, 10+ years of experience in related field


Preferred


Master’s Degree & 5-8 years’ experience in organization change management, data governance, or corporate governance
Experience developing and delivering high-quality briefings and Experience writing for senior leaders to include crafting talking points, recommendations, and value statements
Successful experience in a heavily matrixed organization
Demonstrated ability to lead large scale organization change through influence
Demonstrated ability to learn new technology concepts and identify related risks and downstream effects.
Experience with improving processes and efficiencies 
Strong familiarity with topics related to Artificial Intelligence including Machine Learning, Generative AI, LLMs, etc., and a high-level working knowledge of how they fit together.


Salary Range

$118,272.00 - $214,816.00

Blue Cross NC Corporate Pharmacy Department is seeking an Associate Vice President (AVP) for Government Pharmacy. Collaborate with key areas of the organization to ensure expectations of internal and external stake holders of the pharmacy program are met including healthcare, quality, population health, actuarial, finance, data and analytics and sales
Support the development, execution and maintenance of program performance reporting and monitoring 
Support the development of CMS Part D bids Medicare Advantage, including DSNP, EGWP and the Medicare Prescription Drug Program (Part D)

About the job
Job Description

The Blue Cross NC Diversified Business Group (DBG) is focused on driving improvements in health care, affordability, access and equity through investments and partnerships with innovative health care organizations in North Carolina and beyond. We have a history of forging forward-thinking partnerships and investments with like-minded partners to create the blueprint of the future of health care.

We are seeking a multi-faceted, partnership-focused leader, who can drive both strategic and financial value for a nearly $1 billion strategic investment portfolio that is a combination of non-control, direct equity investments in innovative healthcare companies and fund investments in private equity and venture capital funds.

In this pivotal role, you will leverage industry and portfolio management expertise to oversee and coordinate strategic partnerships, investments and key assets at Blue Cross NC. Responsible for leading the team that is focused on monitoring, tracking, optimizing, and reporting of our portfolio of strategic investments. Assists broadly with relationship management, strategic intelligence, portfolio optimization, and governance while working with senior leaders across the Blue Cross NC organization and at partner companies.

What You’ll Do


Oversee and optimize the performance of strategic partnerships.
Leads the monitoring, tracking, and reporting of strategic, financial, and operational metrics.
Facilitate and coordinate with internal stakeholders across the organization to optimize the partnerships.
Assist in the development and expansion of collaborations across the portfolio, including strategic conversations, negotiations, and legal documentation.
Support capital allocation decisions in the strategic portfolio.
Provide strategic insight to internal stakeholders through proprietary and third-party research, including competitive analyses, M&A activity, and potential innovation in various sectors of healthcare.
Develop and deliver periodic reports and updates for the Board of Trustees, executive management, and the Strategic Investment Committee.


What You’ll Give


Bachelor's degree or advanced degree (where required)
8+ years of experience in related field
In lieu of degree, 10+ years of experience in related field


Bonus Points: (Preferred qualifications)


Bachelor’s degree and a minimum of eight years of professional work experience, with at least six years of direct experience in portfolio management, partnership or business development, FP&A, consulting, investment banking, corporate development, and/or private equity. 
OR Master’s degree and a minimum of six years of professional work experience, with at least four years of direct experience as stated above. 
Five years of experience leading teams and/or directly managing staff.
Increasing levels of responsibility throughout career.
Highly collaborative.
Strong quantitative skills.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.


What You’ll Get

Blue Cross NC is truly a great place to work – and we have the hardware to prove it. Each year, we’re recognized for our commitment to our culture, community, work-life flexibility, benefits, diversity and more. Join us and help us make health care better for all!

description:
About the job
Job Description

IT is different here. Our work as technology specialists pushes the boundaries of what’s possible in health care. You will build solutions that make a real difference in people’s lives. Driven by the importance of their work, our team members innovate to elevate. We’re encouraged to be curious, collaborate, and turn ideas into solutions that can make health care better for all.

The Principal Logical Data Modeler providers leadership in designing, implementing, and documenting complex data architecture and data modeling solutions, which include the use of relational, dimensional, and NoSQL databases. These solutions support enterprise data management, business intelligence, machine learning, data science, and other business interests. In this role you will also be responsible for gathering and understanding data requirements from the business to translate into logical models.

If you are ready to make a career out of making a difference, then you are the person for this team.

What You Will Do


Information Modeling: Establishes and follows data warehousing architectural principles in the creation of data warehouse layers (historical layer, business layers and datamarts) and ensures usability and efficiency of the data warehouse presentation layer. Acts as Subject Matter Expert for information modeling process, techniques and issues across the enterprise. Creates fully attributed and documented conceptual, logical and physical models.
Requirement Analysis: Analyzes data to verify business requirements and design the data models. Provides domain-specific data modeling/ architect coordination to ensure adherence to defined data management and architecture processes.
 Data Architecture: Provides data modeling/architectural expertise that supports integration efforts across enterprise data stores. Provides guidance, road mapping and consulting services for one or more of the strategic domains of the company. Participates in domain/product specific architectural working groups to provide data modeling insights and recommended solutions. Provides inputs on the data management of data assets, architectural inputs on the data consumption layers, access and security requirements, documentation on how data flows from its origination and acquisition points.
Logical Modeling: Acts as harvester of data requirements from the business with translation and development into logical models. To act as single source of truth for logical models. Heavy business facing interaction with deep health insurance knowledge. Technical knowledge around ER Studio, understanding of change control processes and practices, and data lifecycle management.
Standards & Process: Facilitates data model review sessions. Creates, maintains, implements and communicates the data modeling standards and guidelines that support architecture standards and ensure effective evolution of architecture within the organization.

Provides expert inputs on process improvements and maturing the data modeling practice to meet enterprise goals of managing data as a product. description:
About the job
Job Description

Provides technical, clinical and coding expertise to support coding related projects. Consults/collaborates with all plan areas regarding national coding standards and applicability to BCBSNC claims processing systems and reimbursement policy. Presents findings and trends in coding practices to internal/external audiences and makes recommendations regarding coding standards.

What You'll Do


Provide consultative expertise to other areas (e.g. Compliance, Claims Operations, Legal, Network Management, third party vendors and Medical Policy) regarding current and emerging coding/documentation issues.
Develop policies and standard operating procedures for the Healthcare division, which impact multiple business areas to ensure compliance with regulatory agencies, state and federal law and ensure consistency of reviews and operations.
Obtain and maintain all Clinical Code sets as issued from CMS, AMA and ADA.
Collaborate with multiple business areas to determine & ensure proper coding logic in the claims processing systems, based on member benefits & existing guidelines
Acts as a knowledge resource to pricing & expense analyst regarding charge/pricing related issues, providing processing and programming recommendation
Identify trends in coding practices to internal/external audiences and make recommendations regarding coding standards.
Assimilate necessary documentation, including medical records, and apply clinical coding expertise to evaluate appropriateness of provider coding and assess medical necessity of services rendered with referral to Medical Director as appropriate.
Gather appropriate claims data, analyze and prepare summary of analysis to assist in the development of resource allocation strategies to meet changing business needs.
Respond to internal and external inquiries regarding specific medical procedure coding issues and provide education on proper coding techniques via written and/or telephonic communications. 
Develop educational materials for providers identified as outliers and collaborate with Network Management on delivery/communication of information to provider.
Maintain documents for tracking audit results, status/outcomes of reviews etc.
Participate in or lead special projects based on business area needs requiring independent, sound decision making and broad based understanding of impact on the individual department as well as impact on corporate objectives. 


What You'll Bring (Hiring Requirements)


RN or LPN with a valid NC license
3+ years of experience in related field
If LPN, 7+ years of experience in related field
Certified Professional Coder
Special Investigations Unit experience preferred


Salary Range

$68,200.00 - $109,100.00

IT is different here. Our work as technology specialists pushes the boundaries of what’s possible in health care. You will build solutions that make a real difference in people’s lives. Driven by the importance of their work, our team members innovate to elevate. We’re encouraged to be curious, collaborate, and turn ideas into solutions that can make health care better for all.

description:
About the job
Job Description

We are looking for an experienced Contact Center Sr. Business System Analyst to join our already skilled team of experts. You will have a passion for technology and apply it to our high-performance culture. We care deeply about the work we do and the impact it has on our customers. You can take pride in knowing your work has a positive effect on the people of North Carolina.

You’ll be a trusted member of a high energy, tight-knit, creative team. As one of our valued members of the team you will be responsible for the engineering of various and complex aspects of both physical and cloud hosted Contact Center solutions and supporting infrastructures. Using your experience, you will develop and maintain technical standards and procedures for the IT Infrastructure organization in partnership with the Architects, business leads, vendor service providers and IT solution delivery teams as needed. We need for you to be able to analyze operational data, transform and manage business requirements to establish standards for new designs or modifications to existing equipment, systems, or processes. We will look for you to use your interpersonal skills to partner and consult with varied technical, business, project management staff and IT Leaders. We will look for you to leverage your advanced technical knowledge to design, build, deliver and maintain a variety of complex systems and integration.

What You Will Do


Coordinate the planning and development of highly complex engineering designs in support of the implementation of network, compute, telephony, platform, middleware and database solutions. 
Own and maintain technology currency and capacity planning in support of established SLAs.
As cross functional, multi-disciplinary infrastructure Contact Center SME, provide expertise and knowledge in emerging technologies with strategic technology vendors. 
Provide leadership in software and hardware licensing, financial and capacity activities that plan for the most efficient way to introduce and maintain datacenter technology within the environment.
Proactively provide Contact Center strategy and ongoing consultation for IT and Business Leadership areas as well as vendors affected by the BCBSNS Infrastructure and or Contact Center related applications and infrastructures.
Lead the detailed Contact Center infrastructure design of larger and/or more complex internal projects collaborating with IT stakeholders, service owners and partners. 
Provide operational readiness through the engineering, planning, coordination, and delivery of performance and tuning analysis, systems support, incident and problem resolution, software installation, and upgrades.
Maintain appropriate standardized guidelines, work procedures and schedules for solution engineering within the data center environment to expedite workflow and ultimately improve efficiencies.
Build collaborative relationships with the broader IT, business and architecture community to effectively maintain technical roadmaps and provide input into strategies and standards related to area of specialization.
Lead collaboration with vendors on infrastructure designs to ensure the final product is what was architected or designed.
Organize and lead new technology briefings with IT and Enterprise leadership at varied leadership forums.
Provide direction and assistance to less experienced team members and may oversee or coordinate work efforts as needed.


Hiring Preferences


Experience in multiple technical specialties strongly preferred.
Working Experience in the following technologies (Contact Center as a Service (CCaaS), CRM Integration, Genesys, AWS, Call Recording, Storage, Reporting, Private/public carrier services
Proven debugging and high-level technical troubleshooting skills
Exceptional oral and written communication and presentation skills
Ability to effectively manage multiple priorities with excellent organization and planning skillset.
Knowledge of Systems Development Life Cycle Methodologies and process flows.
Ability to correlate technical actions to business impact


Prior Working Experience With


Genesys Administration – Pure Cloud and or Premised based WWE
Development of Interactive Voice Response Systems (IVR)
Implementation of Contact Center Call Routing methods and strategies
Screen Capture and Call Recording
Work force Management tools and Contact Center staffing models
Desktop Computing 
Softphone configuration and design
Telecommunications planning and support
SIP Telephony


Hiring Requirements


Bachelor's degree or advanced degree (where required)
8+ years of experience in related field.
In lieu of degree, 10+ years of experience in related field Significant experience and expertise in the following technical specialties: network, compute, storage, telephony, platform, middleware, and/or database.
Experience automating tasks associated with technical specialties.
Experience successfully leading large and/or multi-faceted Contact Center projects and initiatives.


Salary Range

$75,900.00 - $136,600.00

description:
About the job
Job Description

The Senior Actuarial Analyst will under general guidance and supervision, applies knowledge of mathematics, probability, statistics, and principles of business in order to provide assistance and technical support for rating/pricing, valuation, healthcare economics and/or financial forecasting. Works with a team of actuaries to assure a coordinated approach to the actuarial components of health programs. Provides actuarial support to Network Management, Underwriting, Sales and Marketing, Finance, and/or Healthcare.


Performs actuarial research, experience studies, and statistical analyses and calculations using Excel, SQL, and SAS.
Calculates premiums, risk scores, and reserves of new and existing plans of insurance.
Provides support to senior analysts or actuaries as required.
Retrieves and validates data for actuarial models. Builds model enhancements and determines reasons for changes to calculated factors. Analyzes impacts of changes to product lines and segments.
Communicates filing status to internal stakeholders and transmits rate filings to regulatory agencies (NCDOI, CMS).
Distributes established reports and responds to inquiries. Investigates trends and anomalies.
Provides analytic support for corporate and departmental projects.


Hiring Requirements


Bachelor's degree or advanced degree (where required)
4+ years of experience in relevant actuarial experience. Related experience may be considered.
Completed at least 5 actuarial exams towards the eventual attainment of the ASA designation.


Preferred Skills And Experience


Strong communication and organization skills


This specific position would focus on providing pricing, forecasting, and strategic support for all Blue Cross NC Medicare products. We are considering candidates at multiple pre-credentialed levels.

Salary Range

$75,900.00 - $136,600.00

description:
About the job
Your New Company!

At Altasciences we all move in unison to assist and work in the discovery, development, and manufacturing of new drug therapies to get them faster to people who need them. No matter your role, we all play an important part and you will have a significant impact on the health and well-being of people across the globe. By living our values of Employee Development, Customer Focus, Quality and Excellence, Respect and Integrity, we look to foster a passionate and collaborative work environment and we are looking for talented and enthusiastic people, like you, to join our growing team! Whether you’re a recent college graduate or seeking your next career opportunity, it’s time to discover your future at Altasciences.

We are better together and together We Are Altasciences.

About The Role

Supports the Laboratory Sciences personnel in conducting daily processes, assists staff in the operation and maintenance of equipment, instrumentation, and overall care in the laboratory environment.

What You’ll Do Here


Maintains a safe, clean and orderly laboratory environment.
Assists Research Associate and Scientist and their daily tasks.
Operates and maintains equipment.
Ordering of warehouse supplies and data entry to laboratory inventory records.
Ensures proper documentation and labeling of laboratory reagents.
Disposition of hazardous chemical, generation of the hazardous chemical lab pack and data entry to the laboratory hazardous chemical records.
Documentation and data review practices in compliance with GLP regulations.
Assist staff with study-related procedures.


What You’ll Need To Succeed


High school diploma or GED required; undergraduate work in Biology or related sciences preferred.
6 months - 1 year experience working in a research or laboratory setting.
Basic math and computer skills required.
Ability to troubleshoot basic laboratory equipment.
Ability to read and interpret documents such as SOP's, safety rules, software manuals, and study documents. Ability to write routine correspondence and speak effectively before groups of customers of employees of the organization. 


What We Offer

The pay range estimated for this position is $21.00 - $24.00 hourly. Please note that hourly rates/salaries vary within the range based on factors including, but not limited to, prior relevant experience, skills, education, certification, location as well as internal equity and market data.

Altasciences offers a wide variety of benefits to help our employees live healthy and fulfilling lives both at and outside of work.

Altasciences' Benefits Package Includes


Health/Dental/Vision Insurance Plans
401(k)/RRSP with Employer Match
Paid Vacation and Holidays
Paid Sick and Bereavement Leave
Employee Assistance & Telehealth Programs
Telework when applicable


Altasciences' Incentive Programs Include


Training & Development Programs
Employee Referral Bonus


MOVING IN UNISON TO DELIVER A BIG IMPACT WITH A PERSONAL TOUCH

Altasciences is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. Our goal is to attract, develop and retain highly talented employees from diverse backgrounds, allowing us to benefit from a wide variety of experiences and perspectives. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or any other protected grounds under applicable legislation. Reasonable accommodations for persons with disabilities during the recruitment process are available upon request. Join us at Altasciences!

About The Role

Works under the guidance of designated Study Director(s), Contributing Scientists and Principal Investigators, as appropriate, to provide administrative and professional support for accurate study progression based on Protocols and Method Validation Plans, organization, scheduling,

reporting, client relations and operations.

What You'll Do Here


Assist with the preparation and distribution of Protocols, Analytical Study Plans and Amendments/Amended Protocols.
Schedule and/or help conduct Protocol review meetings with Study Director guidance.
Create study schedules for data collection within the electronic data capture system and implement schedule changes as a result of Protocol Amendments/Amended Protocols, as necessary.
Draft and edit Project Review Forms (PRF) with Study Director guidance.
Assist with preparation and maintenance of study notebooks, study forms, and other necessary materials for studies.
Support the Study Director or Principal Investigator with the planning and hosting of client visits.
Review raw data throughout the life of a study for clerical/technical errors, thoroughness and consistency, and adherence to SOPs, Protocol specifications and compliance with Good Laboratory Practices (GLPs), as appropriate.
Coordinate correction of raw data with appropriate staff. Report any deviations to the Study Director.
Coordinate study activities related to audits.
Perform data verification as needed.

Study Director utilizing electronic publishing tools.
Provide assistance with archiving and preparation of studies for finalization.
Support the Study Director(s), Contributing Scientists and Principal Investigators with the monitoring, tracking and communication of study milestones throughout departments.
Provide coordination for both non-GLP studies and GLP studies from study initiation to finalization under the guidance of the Study Director.

A minimum of 1 year experience in a scientific environment or an equivalent combination of education and experience. 
General to advanced computer skills: proficiency working with MS Word, Excel and Adobe Acrobat.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Working knowledge of descriptive statistics.

About the job
Your New Company!

At Altasciences we all move in unison to assist and work in the discovery, development, and manufacturing of new drug therapies to get them faster to people who need them. No matter your role, we all play an important part and you will have a significant impact on the health and well-being of people across the globe. By living our values of Employee Development, Customer Focus, Quality and Excellence, Respect and Integrity, we look to foster a passionate and collaborative work environment and we are looking for talented and enthusiastic people, like you, to join our growing team! Whether you’re a recent college graduate or seeking your next career opportunity, it’s time to discover your future at Altasciences.

We are better together and together We Are Altasciences.

About The Role

Works under the guidance of designated Study Director(s), Contributing Scientists and Principal Investigators, as appropriate, to provide administrative and professional support for accurate study progression based on Protocols and Method Validation Plans, organization, scheduling,

reporting, client relations and operations.

What You'll Do Here


Assist with the preparation and distribution of Protocols, Analytical Study Plans and Amendments/Amended Protocols.
Schedule and/or help conduct Protocol review meetings with Study Director guidance.
Create study schedules for data collection within the electronic data capture system and implement schedule changes as a result of Protocol Amendments/Amended Protocols, as necessary.
Draft and edit Project Review Forms (PRF) with Study Director guidance.
Assist with preparation and maintenance of study notebooks, study forms, and other necessary materials for studies.
Support the Study Director or Principal Investigator with the planning and hosting of client visits.
Review raw data throughout the life of a study for clerical/technical errors, thoroughness and consistency, and adherence to SOPs, Protocol specifications and compliance with Good Laboratory Practices (GLPs), as appropriate. Coordinate correction of raw data with appropriate staff. Report any deviations to the Study Director.
Coordinate study activities related to audits.
Perform data verification as needed.
Generate data tables for inclusion in reports based on requirements
Assist in the preparation of the report(s) (e.g. drafting the Materials and Methods section), utilizing the appropriate report template.
Collect and collate report components for the final report under the supervision of the
Study Director utilizing electronic publishing tools.
Provide assistance with archiving and preparation of studies for finalization.
Support the Study Director(s), Contributing Scientists and Principal Investigators with the monitoring, tracking and communication of study milestones throughout departments.
Provide coordination for both non-GLP studies and GLP studies from study initiation to finalization under the guidance of the Study Director.


What You'll Need To Succeed


A Bachelor degree or college coursework in a scientific discipline and relevant experience may substitute for the educational requirement.
A minimum of 1 year experience in a scientific environment or an equivalent combination of education and experience. 
General to advanced computer skills: proficiency working with MS Word, Excel and Adobe Acrobat.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Working knowledge of descriptive statistics.


What We Offer

The pay range estimated for this position is $22.00 - $26.00 hourly. Please note that hourly rates/salaries vary within the range based on factors including, but not limited to, prior relevant experience, skills, education, certification, location as well as internal equity and market data.

About the job
Your New Company!

At Altasciences we all move in unison to assist and work in the discovery, development, and manufacturing of new drug therapies to get them faster to people who need them. Whether you’re a recent college graduate or seeking your next career opportunity, it’s time to discover your future at Altasciences.

We are better together and together We Are Altasciences.

About The Role

The Specimen Management Technician I, working under direct supervision, is responsible for the timely and accurate receipt, preparation, management, processing, shipping and/or storage of laboratory specimens in compliance with GLP guidelines, study protocols and SOPs.

What You’ll Do Here


 Responsible for working in compliance with GLP guidelines, protocols and SOPs.
 Coordinate with study directors, coordinators, pathologists, laboratory staff, and vivarium staff
 Prepare, receive, centrifuge, separate and transfer/ship specimens according to SOPs and protocol design with limited supervision
 Maintain and utilize laboratory equipment and instruments
 Maintain chain of custody of all specimens processed and ensure timely transfer of specimens for analysis, archive, shipment or storage
 Maintain documentation of procedures and equipment used and performs quality control of forms and logs
 Maintain laboratory/shipping supplies
 Maintain cleanliness of the department areas
 Cross-train to perform other duties within specimen management
 Assist all areas of specimen management as well as other departments


What You’ll Need To Succeed


High school diploma or general education degree (GED)
Proficiency in MS Word, Excel and Outlook. Navigational skills are desirable
Strong verbal and communication skills including the ability to read and interpret documents such as safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions, software and procedure manuals and study documents.
Must be able to write correspondence and speak effectively with other groups within the organization. Routine reports may be requested
Basic math skills
Strong cross-team collaboration/communication and the ability to be flexible and work quickly and efficiently in a fast-paced environment
Detail-oriented with problem solving and trouble-shooting skills
Handles and disposes biological and/or chemical substances and wastes in accordance with applicable policies and procedures
Wears appropriate PPE in accordance with policies and procedures. PPE may include but is not limited to: N-95 respirator, face mask, safety glasses, goggles, face shield, gloves, and lab coat.
Be able to work occasionally weekends, evenings, and some holidays


What We Offer

The pay range estimated for this position is $19.00 - $25.00 (per hour rates or annually). Please note that hourly rates/salaries vary within the range based on factors including, but not limited to, prior relevant experience, skills, education, certification, location as well as internal equity and market data.

title: Research Associate I, Scientific Services with verification
insight: ['$22.25/hr - $28.98/hr Full-time Entry level', '1,001-5,000 employees · Research Services', 'Skills: Mathematics, Basic Math, +8 more', 'See recent hiring trends for Altasciences. Try Premium for $0']
description:
About the job
Your New Company!

At Altasciences we all move in unison to assist and work in the discovery, development, and manufacturing of new drug therapies to get them faster to people who need them. No matter your role, we all play an important part and you will have a significant impact on the health and well-being of people across the globe. By living our values of Employee Development, Customer Focus, Quality and Excellence, Respect and Integrity, we look to foster a passionate and collaborative work environment and we are looking for talented and enthusiastic people, like you, to join our growing team! Whether you’re a recent college graduate or seeking your next career opportunity, it’s time to discover your future at Altasciences.

We are better together and together We Are Altasciences.

About The Role

Research Associate I will perform technical procedures, restrain animals, operate laboratory equipment, collect specimens, and data on laboratory animals (mice, rats, rabbits, canines, non-human primates, etc.) as specified in protocols and Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs), and in compliance with GLP standards. Support study supervisor(s) and study director(s) by performing and assisting with sample and data collection on research studies.

What You’ll Do Here


 Follow SOPs and Protocols to perform procedures on study and stock animals, including, but not limited to: clinical observations, food consumptions, body weights, urine collection, administering injectable anesthesia, mating procedures, blood draws (all routes), dose administration (all routes), euthanasia, catheter placement, restraint, enrichment, feeding and food removal
 Follow written and verbal instruction: Standard Operating Procedures (SOP), protocols, daily schedules
 Record, enter and review raw data, study and facility
 Set up for procedures and maintains ancillaries on study animals
 Operate selected laboratory equipment (i.e., glucometer, Harvard pump, digital thermometer)
 Monitor and report changes in animal behavior or health, and problems with animal rooms (e.g., caging, lights, and temperature) to all appropriate personnel
 Maintain general cleanliness and organization of work areas
 Monitor and report study changes to study director and all appropriate personnel
 Review and provide input on the creation and revision of SOPs relating to animals, technical procedures and facility issues
 Perform husbandry duties
 Cross training in other departments available


What You’ll Need To Succeed


 High school diploma or equivalent, required; BA/BS in a scientific discipline preferred
 Experience working with animals in research or a regulated environment preferred
 ALAT certification preferred
 Intermediate computer experience including Microsoft Office suite, Project, Info Path and Access
 Readily adapts to new software
 English proficiency required to read and interpret documents such as industry specific documents, write routine reports and correspondence
 Basic math skills as they apply to interpreting scientific data
 Solid reasoning abilities
 Work cross functionally on process improvements
 Demonstrates attention to detail while multi-tasking
 Maintain organization in a fast paced, changing environment
 Able to manage change
 Readily adapts to new projects
 Positive attitude toward work and co-workers
 Comfortable communicating with all levels of management and employees
 Identify and resolve problems as they are encountered
 Practical problem solving skills when deal with a variety of concrete variables
 Interpret a variety of instructions furnished in written, verbal, diagram, or schedule form


What We Offer

The pay range estimated for this position is $22.25 - $28.98 hourly. Please note that hourly rates/salaries vary within the range based on factors including, but not limited to, prior relevant experience, skills, education, certification, location as well as internal equity and market data.

Altasciences offers a wide variety of benefits to help our employees live healthy and fulfilling lives both at and outside of work.

Health/Dental/Vision Insurance Plans
401(k)/RRSP with Employer Match
Paid Vacation and Holidays
Paid Sick and Bereavement Leave
Employee Assistance & Telehealth Programs
Telework when applicable

About The Role

The primary responsibilities of the Participant Recruitment Agent are to pre-screen participants by phone to determine their eligibility to screen for an actively enrolling study, to explain preliminary study and company details and to update the participant database.

What You'll Do Here


Review and understand all assigned actively enrolling study protocols
Pre-screen participants to determine their eligibility to come in for a screening visit
Enter/update participant demographic information and medical history in the recruitment database
Answer incoming calls, internet applications
Where applicable, promotes and ensures that all potential participants have access to participant lounge;
Contact past callers to update information and determine eligibility

High school diploma or GED or higher; college degree is preferred. 
One (1) year experience in a call center and medical terminology knowledge are assets.
Skills: Active Learning - Understanding the implications of new information for both current and future problem-solving and decision-making.
Active Listening - Giving full attention to what other people are saying, taking time to understand the points being made, asking questions as appropriate, and not interrupting at inappropriate times.
Critical Thinking - Using logic and reasoning to identify the strengths and weaknesses of alternative solutions, conclusions or approaches to problems.
Learning Strategies - Selecting and using training/instructional methods and procedures appropriate for the situation when learning or teaching new things.
Mathematics - Using mathematics to solve problems.
Reading Comprehension - Understanding written sentences and paragraphs in work related documents.
Speaking - Talking to others to convey information effectively.
Writing - Communicating effectively in writing as appropriate for the needs of the audience
Coordination – Adjusting actions in relation to others’ actions.
Social Perceptiveness – Being aware of others’ reactions and understanding why they react as they do.
Computer Skills - Windows, Word, Excel, Outlook, Internet Navigation and Data Entry.

About the job
Your New Company!

At Altasciences we all move in unison to assist and work in the discovery, development, and manufacturing of new drug therapies to get them faster to people who need them. No matter your role, we all play an important part and you will have a significant impact on the health and well-being of people across the globe. By living our values of Employee Development, Customer Focus, Quality and Excellence, Respect and Integrity, we look to foster a passionate and collaborative work environment and we are looking for talented and enthusiastic people, like you, to join our growing team! Whether you’re a recent college graduate or seeking your next career opportunity, it’s time to discover your future at Altasciences.

We are better together and together We Are Altasciences.

About The Role

To perform this job successfully, the individual is required to perform, but not limited to: the preparation of quality tissue samples for histopathologic evaluation; identification of tissue samples for proper embedding orientation; tissue processing for paraffin and frozen tissue samples; microtomy skills for routine paraffin, and frozen tissue samples; preparation of reagents and the performance of routine hematoxylin and eosin (H&E), non-routine histochemical staining and manual/automated immunohistochemistry (IHC) procedures; performs quality control procedures on all prepared microscope slides; knowledge of the use and maintenance of equipment used for the preparation of tissue samples and the ability to maintain a clean and orderly laboratory environment.

What You'll Do Here


Maintains and documents the use and maintenance of laboratory equipment
Maintains a safe, clean and orderly laboratory environment
Performs paraffin tissue processing
Identifies required tissue sample orientation and performs paraffin embedding procedures
Uses microtomy skills in the preparation of routine (paraffin embedded) microscopic slides according to standard operating procedures and/or required by study protocols
Performs routine hematoxylin and eosin (H&E) staining as well as cover slipping microscopic slides
Troubleshoots equipment and/or operation failures and takes appropriate actions to keep interruptions to a minimum
Analyzes raw data collection and solves for deviation in standard operating procedures (SOP) and/or protocol requirements
Disposition of hazardous chemical, generation of the hazardous chemical lab pack and data entry to the laboratory hazardous chemical records
Ordering of warehouse supplies and data entry to laboratory inventory records may be assigned


What You'll Need To Succeed


Bachelor of Science degree (BS). Associate's degree (AA), with equivalent experience and training.
Work experience includes, but not limited to at least 3 + years laboratory experience and/or training HT (ASCP) eligible within one year of employment
Identification of tissue organs and/or tissue samples; microtomy skills and routine hematoxylin and eosin staining preferred Handles and disposes biological and/or chemical substances and wastes in accordance with applicable policies and procedures
Wears appropriate PPE in accordance with policies and procedures. PPE may include, but is not limited to: N-95 respirator, face mask, safety glasses, goggles, face shield, gloves, and lab coat


What We Offer

The hourly pay range estimated for this position is $22 - $29. Please note that salary rates vary within the range based on factors including, but not limited to, prior relevant experience, skills, education, certification, location as well as internal equity and market data.

About the job
Your New Company!

At Altasciences we all move in unison to assist and work in the discovery, development, and manufacturing of new drug therapies to get them faster to people who need them. No matter your role, we all play an important part and you will have a significant impact on the health and well-being of people across the globe. Whether you’re a recent college graduate or seeking your next career opportunity, it’s time to discover your future at Altasciences.

We are better together and together We Are Altasciences.

About The Role

Do you love working with animals? Do you want to contribute to advancing human health science research? Do you like to work in small teams?

Altasciences is seeking Research Associates at all levels of experience that have a passion for scientific research. In this position your focus will be working directly with larger animals in the collection of data and in support of the development of human medicine. You will perform technical procedures to support advancements in pharmaceutical development. In this position you will learn and perfect complex procedures including learning the skills to operate laboratory equipment, specimens collection techniques and data acquisition. At Altasciences Preclinical Services, we work with many different large animal models: non-human primates, swine and canine and you will have the opportunity to become a proficient, highly skilled expert in this field. Multiple shifts available.

What You'll Do Here


Conducting sample and data collection on research studies
Perform standard operating procedures and execute Protocol driven activities on laboratory animals. For example; clinical observations, food consumptions, body weights, urine collection, administering anesthesia, mating procedures, blood draws, dose administration catheter placement, enrichment, feeding
Responsible for recording, entering and reviewing raw data
Prepares for procedures by setting up and maintaining ancillaries on study animals
Operating specialized laboratory equipment such as; Glucometer, Harvard pump, Digital Thermometer, infusion pumps, telemetry devices etc
Monitor and report changes and concerns in animal behavior or health, and problems with animal rooms (e.g., caging, lights, and temperature) to all appropriate personnel
Monitor and report all study changes to the Study Supervisor and Study Director
All work must be performed at the highest quality and with the highest regard for animal welfare


What You'll Need To Succeed


BS/BA in a scientific discipline preferred. Must have high School Diploma and/or GED required
1 to 2 years experience working with small animals, in research, or in a regulated environment
ALAT or LAT Certification preferred
Ability to perform high quality work with strong attention to detail
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Ability to problem solve and know when to ask questions
Ability to work collaboratively with all levels of employees
Ability to multi-task and maintain organization in a fast paced, changing environment
Positive attitude toward work and strong team player
Be a part of a team that likes to work hard and have fun
Ability to lift up to 30-50 pounds required


What We Offer

The pay range estimated for this position is $21.75-$30.43 (per hour rates or annually). Please note that hourly rates/salaries vary within the range based on factors including, but not limited to, prior relevant experience, skills, education, certification, location as well as internal equity and market data.

Are you ready to embark on a dynamic and stimulating career in research? Altasciences invites you to join our team as a Research Associate at our cutting-edge Preclinical site in Everett, Washington. Immerse yourself in a fast-paced, innovative environment where you'll play a pivotal role in the daily operations of the Laboratory Sciences laboratory.

About The Role

As a Research Associate II, you will be at the forefront of groundbreaking research, contributing to the success of our laboratory through diverse responsibilities that go beyond the ordinary. Engage in hands-on activities such as equipment maintenance, supply stocking, and general cleaning while supporting our Biomarker assay team.

What You’ll Do Here


Execute routine laboratory maintenance, ensuring a pristine and efficient workspace.
Prepare materials, including animal blood and tissues, for analytical assays, performing assays with precision and meticulous documentation.
Maintain and document the chain of custody for specimens, reagents, controls, and samples within the laboratory.
Update facility records related to the laboratory and its analyses.
Review laboratory records, procedures, and study data for completeness and accuracy.
Document deviations to laboratory procedures and study protocols promptly, providing insights for corrective actions.
Contribute to the calibration, optimization, maintenance, and data collection from analytical instruments.
Actively participate in training and educational opportunities.
Collaborate with other departments as needed.


What You’ll Need To Succeed


Associate degree in scientific discipline plus a minimum of 6 months relevant laboratory experience, or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
Proven ability to handle multiple assignments and maintain organization in a dynamic, fast-paced environment.
Intermediate computer skills, including proficiency with Microsoft Word and Excel.
Strong reading and interpretation skills for safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions, software manuals, study documents, and procedure manuals.
Effective communication skills for addressing groups of customers or employees.
Intermediate to Advanced Math Skills.
Experience with Large Molecule PK or Biomarker preferred.

Altasciences is seeking Research Associates at all levels of experience that have a passion for scientific research. In this position your focus will be working directly with animals in the collection of data and in support of the development of human medicine. You will perform technical procedures to support advancements in pharmaceutical development. In this position you will learn and perfect complex procedures including learning the skills to operate laboratory equipment, specimens collection techniques and data acquisition. At Altasciences Preclinical Services, we work with many different animal models: mice, rats, non-human primates, swine and canine and you will have the opportunity to become a proficient, highly skilled expert in this field. Multiple shifts available.

What You’ll Do Here


Follows SOPs and Protocols to perform procedures on study and stock animals, including, but not limited to: clinical observations, food consumptions, body weights, urine collection, administering injectable anesthesia, mating procedures, blood draws (all routes), euthanasia/necropsy, catheter placement, restraint, enrichment, and feeding and food removal.
Creates study specific forms/labels, as assigned.
Follows written and verbal instruction: Standard Operating Procedures (SOP), Protocols, Daily Schedules.
Records, enters and reviews raw data, study and facility.
Sets up for procedures and maintains ancillaries on study animals, including surgical procedure support (e.g., sterile preparation, anesthesia machine set up & monitoring, and post-surgery recovery).
Operates selected laboratory equipment (e.g., glucometer, Harvard pump, digital thermometer, centrifuge, incubator).
Monitors and reports changes in animal behavior or health, and problems with animal rooms (e.g., caging, lights, and temperature) to all appropriate personnel.
Maintains general cleanliness and organization of work areas.
Monitors and reports study changes to Study Director and all appropriate personnel
May review and provide input on the creation and revision of SOPs relating to animals, technical procedures and facility issues.
Perform and/or assist with veterinary treatments of research and colony animals as assigned.
Perform abnormal behavior assessment of colony animals and assist in the animal socialization program, as assigned.
May perform husbandry duties.
May cross train in other departments.


What You’ll Need To Succeed


High School Diploma and/or GED required; BS/BA in a scientific discipline preferred.
0-2 years experience working with animals, in research, or in a regulated environment.
ALAT certification preferred.
The ability to work with Microsoft Word, Excel, Project, Info Path, Access, Outlook, and PowerPoint. Able to adapt easily to new software programs.
The ability to read and interpret documents such as safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions, software manuals, study documents, and procedure manuals; and the ability to write routine reports and correspondence.
The math skills required include but are not limited to: the ability to understand and utilize appropriate mathematical concepts for calculating and interpreting scientific data.
Ability to work cross functionally on process improvements. Demonstrated attention to detail. Ability to multi-task and maintain organization in a fast paced, changing environment. Ability to manage change. Readily adapts to new projects. Positive attitude toward work and co-workers. Be comfortable communicating with all levels of management and employees. Able to identify and resolve problems as they are encountered.


What We Offer

Altasciences offers a wide variety of benefits to help our employees live healthy and fulfilling lives both at and outside of work.

Altasciences' Benefits Package Includes


Health/Dental/Vision Insurance Plans
401(k)/RRSP with Employer Match
Paid Vacation and Holidays
Paid Sick and Bereavement Leave
Employee Assistance & Telehealth Programs


Altasciences' Incentive Programs Include


Training & Development Programs.
Employee Referral Bonus Program

Altasciences is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. Our goal is to attract, develop and retain highly talented employees from diverse backgrounds, allowing us to benefit from a wide variety of experiences and perspectives.
